review_content: Goose Island Sofie 6.5%. Hazy pale golden, banana and citrus aroma, medium bodied, wheat malt, banana, citrus, orange peel, sour yeast, spices. Lovely Saison from Chicago, Illinois 🇺🇸

한국 구스아일랜드 브루하우스에서 400ml 16,000원에 제공됩니다.

와인통 숙성에 세종스타일로 양조한 하이브리드 맥주로서 외관은 뉴잉 스타일로 평범하지만

살짝 스파이시 그러니까 와인 탄닌의 떫음으로 시작해서, 오렌지를 기반한 달달한 시트러스 풍미에 바이젠의 바닐라향과 꽃향 그리고 부드러운 피니시까지 갖춘 아로마 풍부한 맥주입니다. 토요일을 더 행복한 토요일로 만들어주기 충분했죠.

그나저나 난 이게 비누플래버, 즉 소피한 풍미를 내기에 이름이 소피인줄 알았는데 구스아일랜드 설립자 '존 홀'의 발랄한 손녀 이름이 Sofie였다고....

이거 가끔 편의점이 미쳐서 4병짜리 팩 15,000원 내외로 예약제로 팔때 있는데 반드시 득템해야할 품목 중 하나!

Bottle, 355ml. A hazy golden colour with no head. A rich blackberry and bread aroma with bitter pip notes. Flavour is slightly sour with bitter pip notes, grapefruit, a slight herbal funk. High carbonation. A bitter, herbal finish.

Bottled, 355ml from Tesco in Banbury, Oxon. Hazed gold with white (though short) head. There is a pleasant, fruity, yeasty character to this on first sip, some astringency, some ester type notes with fruit peel flavours. There are pale grape hints with a note of tartness, some melon flavours too. Overall pretty decent I would say.

330ml Bottle from Tesco, Hexham.

Sofie 2017 drank in 2021. Drank in Celebration of Omloop Het Nieuwsblad Belgian Cycle Race. Hazy straw coloured with a thick white head of foam. It has a tart lemon, orange peel and vanilla flavour with yeast, spices and a smooth, dry wine-like finish. Excellent!

Very slightly hazy pale gold with a lovely bubbly white head, and a soft fruity aroma with a dusty, yeasty kind of vibe. The mouthfeel is zesty and spritzy, like a sparkling wine, and you're getting grapes and melon in the flavour along with some tart apples and citrus fruit, and a hint of spice in the finish. Slips down wonderfully and is fabulously refreshing

2017 vintage from Tesco (£3):
Clear golden with a stream of fine bubbles rising to a thin, quarter centimetre head that's white & foamy, covering the surface well. It's floral, fresh & quite lively on the nose with Belgian yeast, pepper, background spices & some touches of grapes, apple & peach too. There's a slightly funky feel to it that carries of the to the taste that's dominated by a mix of apples & grapes followed by floral touches. It was quite a sharp, dry beer with a light-medium body & it was definitely more balanced than normal for a saison - a decent beer.
Bottle at Larry’s Beerfest. Poured light hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of citrus, orange, white wine, yeast, fruity, pepper spice. Taste was sweet, tart, sour, citrus, orange, yeast, wine.

Bottle from Tesco, Brooklands. Vinous aroma (of course), with spicy yeast and citrus. Opaque light gold. Initially impressive frothy white head soon shrinks away. Light-medium sour with a bitter edge. Zesty. Spicy, particularly into the finish. Underlying vinousness. The vinous element and a dose of sherbert cone to the fore combined with the citrus.  Light bodied. Thin if slick. Fizzy carbonation. Very dry slightly astringent finish. This went down quickly. Good stuff.

Butelka. Lekko metnawe o złotym kolorze. Piana biała, niska, opadła szybko. Ciekawe piwo... Sporo skórki pomarańczowej od samego początku, drożdżowe akcenty, białe owoce, lekkie banany i ziarniste posmaki. Powstaje wrażenie zacieru na ciasto. Wysycenie średnie, lekkie nuty winne I beczkowe. Ok

Bottled July 17 - from Tesco - extraordinary that bottles with this age are in supermarkets.  Nose is brett, dough, chocolate limes, almond, vanilla, lime. Taste is dry, lime, dough, vanilla, hint of peach and melon, very faint white grape; brett is a lot less present than the nose would suggest, with a very light sourness. Pepper and a little spice with a dry vinious finish. 

Really very enjoyable, and great for a supermarket beer.

Sept 2020. 355ml brown bottle, unfiltered, from Tesco. Nice. I like this. There's a delicate play between the doughy malt and the warm yeast. Quite delicate. A faint tartness. Pleasant fruits. There's a lot going on here, and it's all complimentary. Put the right malt and yeast together in appropriate conditions, and magic will happen. You don't need to put in additional flavours of chocolate or mushrooms or chillies or modern hops. Just the magic of yeast and malt. The magic here is not awesome, but it is elegant. [3.5]
Cloudy amber with a small white head, aroma of hay, also slightly lemony. Taste, floral, wheaty, banana, with coriander and honey. Well carbonated. Brisk and refreshing. Appealing label design.
355ml bottle from Tesco - Cloudy yellow body, no head. Nose has orange peel, a bit of yeast, coriander. Bit watery for the ABV, fairly bland.
Hazy golden appearance. Aroma is grassy and sweet. Flavour is tart, grassy, hops, floral and citrus.

Bottle from Tescos, Lewisham. Gold pour with a white head. 
Roast parsnips, banana, green apple, light funky aroma (HEYY!!). Taste is cinnamon, apple crumble, banana toffee. Long sweet finish. Plenty of sweet and sour notes in the nose, not much sourness in the flavour. Interesting little number.
330ml bottle.  Pours hazy orange gold with a medium head. Aroma is tart sherbet lemon with a little pepper.  Taste has sour lemon to start with pepper on the finish.  Touch of sweaty socks.

Yellow with no head and devoid of any life. Nice fruity flavour which is very typical of a saison Some bitterness and a bitter finish. Pleasant but I struggled to find any reason for it being so highly rated. My first from this brewery for some time.

Bottle at home picked up from Tesco . 2017 bottle. A light hazed dirty straw coloured pour with a fine off white head. aroma is straw, beligan yeast, brett, tart vinous notes,  bitter lemon, grass, clove. Flavour is composed of semi sweet, mellow bretty funk, lemon, rounded Belgian yeast profile, light mealy apple, hint of banana. Palate is semi sweet, light tart, highish carbonationGood stuff.

355 ml bottle from Tesco, bottled 11/07/2017, bb 08/2022
Golden, hazy, white head dissipating to a ring.
Nose - rich, deep funk, citrus and spices. Best smelling barnyard ever, can't get enough.
Taste - citrus, pepper. Dry. Prickly carbonation.
I like it.
5/20 straw, grass and then overpowering overriding murk and funk. too hardcore for me
Bière blonde trouble. Nez vinaigré, sur la levure. Bouche sur les céréales avec une forte acidité. Ce n'est pas mon délire mais j'ai vu pire.
清新又满是香气的一瓶酒，入口就能喝到很明显的橘皮香气、葡萄酒桶的一点点单宁的酸涩感，后面有胡椒的一点点spice感。易饮，有层次，富有香气，和之前喝过的其它比利时白啤比如福佳白比，非常明显地上了一个台阶。好喝，会回购
Pours golden with big white head. Aromatic Belgian spicy yeast, malty, citrus aroma. Taste is tangy citrus, pepper, malty, big carbonated brew. Light body but flavorful. Not bad at all.

Bottle from Beer Hawk in 2018.  Bottled May 2017; BB not stated; Drank Feb 2020 - Clear pale gold.  Small foamy white head.  Fruity, citrus lemon, peel, white wine.  Yeasty,  funk.  Spicy, pepper.  Malty, wheaty.  Dry.  Sweet-bitter citrus fruity yeasty spicy wheaty.  Enjoyed this.  Good stuff.  (2020-02)

35,5cl-fles (uit 2017) van bij saveur-biere.com. U: Helder blond met een witte schuimkraag die wegzakt. G: Citrus, brett, groene appel en een tikje munt. S: Zoet met een licht zuurtje. Citrus, brett, groene appel en wat vineus. Droge afdronk. M: Doordrinker met medium carbonatie.

Large frothy white head. Good lacing. Fully diminishing. Translucent dark-yellow body. Aroma: light hoppy, orange, lime, spicy, moderate yeasty. initial flavor: light sweet moderate acidic very light bitter. final flavor: very light sweet, moderate acidic light bitter; average duration. palate: light medium body, dry/watery texture, lively carbonation moderate astringent finish. agradável, mas um pouco mais ácida que a média, faltando o tradicional sabor de maçã do estilo, suave caráter maltado, azedume substituindo o amargor, caráter frutado cítrico, como previsto nas BJCP, 60 s
Thuis uit een flesje. Licht troebel, gouden kleur, geen schuim (misschien te koud?). Aardig fris zuur in smaak en aroma, prima fris bier.

330 ml bottle bought in www.casadelacerveza.cl . This is one of 2017 (i love when beers have a year in it). Complex aroma, pretty good, pepper, cinnamon, orange, lemon, belgium smell in general but more fresh; good job there. Deep creamy golden color, low head. Taste is something new, very soft for 6.5%, complex, well made, but just not my thing. Fades with time. Good and creative beer though.
Nice golden pour with thin head. Wheaty nose. Farmy, light sour, a bit sweet. One of the best saisons ive ever had
From a beer hawk mystery case.  Pours light orange and slightly cloudy. Aroma of lemons and apples.  Light , sweet and fruity , almost cider like.

Version 2017. Robe jaune paille. Nez sur les Bretts. Faible carbonation, assez sèche, Saison très agréable. L'apport du fût de vin blanc et des écorces d'oranges est plus timide sur ce millésime (blend de 10 % seulement contre 20 % les années précédentes).
Great “typecity” though pours relatively thin head. Hazy straw. Dry with clear orange peels notes and bitterness.
Bardzo fajny saison. Goryczka wyraźna, dobrze komponuje się z typowo belgijskimi nutami.

2013 and 2018 vintages compared side to side in mid 2019. 
2013 vintage darker yellow hazy with modest fine dark sediment. Aroma of grass, citrus clementine, vinegar, barnyard funk. Smells like home brew. Tastes like a saison should, but a bit more rounded with some tartness. Clementines hints. 
2018 vintage tastes very different. Much brighter with more tartness. Similar saison notes. Some lemongrass notes in there too. 
Both good

Belle robe pâle,  très peu de mousse.
Très beaux arômes fruités,  frais, agrumes ...
Très bonne bouche, longue et soyeuse...
Un régal...
Acidez limpia y bastante contenida. Se le nota el cítrico. Muy redonda y bebible. Una grata curiosidad!

12 oz. bottle at home.  Pours a slightly hazy yellow with minimal head that dissipates quickly.  The aroma has barnyard-like qualities with hints of citrus.  The taste is balanced with notes of pepper, yeast, orange, and a general funkiness.  The beer leans dry and the barrel aging of a portion of the beer lends a mellow vanilla note that smooths out the beer's tartness.  Overall, this beer is subtly complex and interesting in a good way.

355ml bottle @ Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury. Pours an unclear lightly misty gold, minimal froth atop. Aroma has doughy white wine and saison yeast leanings. Taste presents a gentle carbonation that allows that saison yeast sweetness to shine, low murmurrings of white wine adding subtle depth of flavour. Decent.

Thanks for the taster @shockdesign. 1 year old bottle. Beautiful looking beer with a light fizz and earthy aroma. Tropical sweetness and mild spice notes are plenty throughout with a lot of barrel flavour present too.
Pours golden, very light. Sweet aroma. Slight tartiness on initial sip but mellowing out leaving a great taste at the end. Easy good summer drink.
Pours golden, smells summery, punches of citrus at the front and mellows at the back.
Geel bier met een fijne koolzuur parel, smaakt zoet en droog met tonen van vanille, citrus en graan.

Robe or clair, presque paille, quasi limpide, juste un très léger voile. Mousse moyenne, un peu grossière, dure assez peu, mais très belle carbo. Nez de saison, aux notes un peu animales, arômes d'agrumes. Attaque plutôt ronde, agréable, suivie rapidement par le côté animal et les saveurs de levure. Fruité qui s'étend dans la longueur, les agrumes se sentent sans être trop prégnants. Amertume herbacée qui se sent dans la longueur. C'est équilibré, dans le style, aromatique, plutôt sympa.

Pours cloudy golden yellow, think cloudy cider. Aroma is very faint saison and orange peel. Taste has orange peel similar to a wheat beer, has a light white pepper taste. The finish is slightly creamy, dry and also a bit sweet. Good, but not amazing especially as this quite expensive in the UK.
Birra particolare...olfatto e primo impatto gustativo lievemente acidulo e citrico..dopo un po' emerge anche il fruttato e lo speziato. Non il mio genere preferito, ma non male.

$3.49 bottle, Total Wine - Gainesville, VA. Pale gold pour, minor haze, small white head. Aroma of dried flowers, barnyard funk, hay, earth, damp tree bark. Flavor is dried flowers, yeast, green grasses, light bitter apricot, light funk, hay, light earth.
Yellow colour with lasting head. Aroma and flavour have light yeast and grape notes. Very clean. Refreshing.

White weak head. Golden colour. Aroma is moderately hoppy with sour, peppery and fruity (pineapple and citrus) notes. Flavor is moderately hoppy with fruity (apple, pear) and slightly sour and spicy tones, ending in a moderately sour finish. Light bodied.

En copa, cerveza pálida ligeramente túrbia con una fina capa de espuma blanca. Aroma suave a cereales, paja, granero, piel de cítricos, manzana verde ácida, y levadura. En boca, textura acuosa y ligera, de carbonatación media/alta y amargor suave. Presenta un sabor ácido que recuerda a la manzana verde, junto con cítricos como naranja y limón, cereales blancos, levadura, y un regusto astringente al final. Una Saison muy cítrica y frutal, donde esa nota intensa de acidez encaja perfectamente en la cerveza. Totalmente recomendable.

Bottled 0,355L. Hazy and bright yellow color, much bubbly aspect with discreet white head of medium duration. Fresh and spiced aroma, notes of yest, lemon, aged grapes, cellar, citrus. Lively and crisp taste, pleasant carbonation with sour and agreable acid notes of lemon, yeast, orange peer, aged white grapes, young wine.

Bottle of the 2016 vintage poured into a chalice on 2/2/19. Golden color and a fizzy white head. Champagne grapes, orange, and Belgian yeast in the aroma. Initial taste is champagne, citrus. Aftertaste fades to a mellow oakiness. Lively carbonation and a full body.

355 ml bottle, served in a teku glass, due date: unknown, bottled at 2017/07.

Aroma: quite intense aromas of grapes, slightly sour grape must, slightly sour white wine. Hints of Brettanomyces, barnyard.

Appearance: straw yellow color with perfectly white and very creamy foam made of medium to big sized bubbles. High head thickness with low retention, low Brussels' lacing and low to medium haziness.

Taste: low to medium sweetness, low bitterness, low to medium sourness. Flavors of white grapes, slightly sour white wine. Hints of citrus, Brettanomyces, barnyard. Quite well balanced. 

Palate: low to medium body, mainly watery texture, medium to high carbonation, quite long sweet and dry finish with low to medium sweetness and low bitterness and the same aforementioned flavors. Alcohol is no noticeable in aroma or flavor but noticeable because of some throat and mouth warming. Low but noticeable astringency.

Overall: quite good looking, quite good aromas and flavors of white grapes, slightly sour white wine, hints of orange, tangerine, citrus. Not a great fan of the style but not bad. Refreshing and thirst-quenching.

@ Wildeman, Brettfest 2017. The aroma has citrus, melons, slight spice tones. Hazy, yellow coloured beer with a thin, white head. The taste is spicy, has melons, citric tones, some peel. Refreshing brew. Finishes dry.

Espuma bastante efervescente porém de baixa persistência e cremosidade. 
Levemente ácida com aspecto sour. 
Bom aroma com toques de laranja.

Lightly cloudy yellow with the fingers of extra foamy head. Aroma of hay, barnyard, maybe a little coriander. Taste is light with hay, a little citrus and a little coriander. Nice light drinking but not very impactful flavor.

Bottiglia da 35 cl imbottigliata il 29/09/2016, bevuta il 13/12/2019. Questa saison è caratterizzata da un buon aroma con sentori di spezie, agrumi e uva. Sapore con note erbacee e speziate tipiche di una saison, mischiate a sentori di uva e frutta secca. Carbonazione decisamente vivace, forse eccessiva. Nel complesso più che discreta.

12oz Bottle of Sofie vintage 2013

Appearance: pours deep golden with 1/2" frothy off-white head that retains well. the beer is hazy and effervescent with not much lacing being observed.
Aroma: hops derived aromas are grassy and earthy and mixed yeast produces estery, citrusy as well as spicy peppery notes. malt produces a slight hay-like aroma
Taste: very light malt sweetness, medium-high bitterness with significant tart, tangy acidity that differentiates this saison from others.
Palate: medium-light body, creamy texture, lively carbonation and pronounced astringency
Overall: dry finish with lingering spice and bitterness. overall this is a phenomenal beer with 5 years behind it and absolutely no signs of deterioration!

On Tap at PreFunk Boise.  Cant believe I still havent checked in to this.  Clear deep golden pour. Classic Belgian light golden malty aromas.  Mellow farmhouse yeat flavors, and quite slick and smooth.  Almost buttery.  Expected a cleaner drier beer.

Sophie est très élégante. Une couleur jaune clair bien nette, un arôme très fin, un tout petit peu de levure sauvage mais très faiblement perceptible, un gout de fruit (orange, pomme). Amertume bien, alcool bien. Bère très équilibrée.

fresh 12 oz 2011 bottle - 6/3/11 date - served cold. 

Appearance - a hazy pale yellow with a small white head that quickly settles to a lasting ring. Visible moderate carbonation. 

The appearance is a little funky; the aroma more so. In fact, it smells like it has gone bad or is at least on the way. There's plenty of over-ripe banana, hints of pineapple and over-ripe apples, along with other less distinguishable fruits. The aroma is yeasty but also quite funky and too similar to a moldy odor. The beer is fresh from the store, however, and has a recent bottling date, so the beer should be in fine condition. Hence, I try to over look suggestions of moldy wine and take a sip. 

Tasting reveals a more palatible product than the nose suggests. In fact, with a strong citrus component [mainly lemon] and mild spiciness (mainly clove) added to the funky yeast flavors, this beer is rather interesting and passably drinkable although a bit challenging -- certainly not high praise on a very hot and thirsty afternoon. Earthy with hints of sour fruits and more than a hint of yeast.

M - Good carbonation streaming up from the bottom is also evident in the mouthfeel of this medium bodied and rather crisp beer. Has an unfortunate bit of a peppery bite on the tongue. Semi-dry finish. 

O - While interesting, as beers in this category generally are, I cannot recommend this particular saison to any but fans of sour beers with a strong banana component. Perhaps aging is required.

Appearance: hazy golden, good head
Aroma: spices, pepper
Mouthfeel: medium full, medium high carbonation
Taste: spices, peppery. Clean bitterness
Overall: great beer
Very strong in many features and a little too carbonated. Nice aroma and fine aftertaste too.
Found from bottle. Nice and hazy. Really enjoyable from beginning to end. Gets more complex as it warms. Really delicious.

Bottle at home, 17/08/18.
Lightly hazed golden with a decent off white cap. 
Nose is lemon rind, bittersweet citric peel, yeast flicker, on the turn melon, stale bread, grains.
Taste comprises tarte citric fruit, light barnyard esters, mellow yeast, faint white peppery spice, lime leaf, grassy.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a tangy citric laden climax. 
Solid saison.
I enjoyed Sofie so much I think I need to sit my wife down and tell her the truth.
Absolutely lovely beer. Such a refreshing, fruity aroma and delicious sparkly mouthfeel. Feels like a champagne in your mouth
I love this beer, but the price tag is quite steep for a 6.5% abv beer. It is delicious and I would recommend anyone to at least try it once. It is cloudy, with a soft, sweet taste of orange.

Bouteille 35,5 cL, Saveur Bière, chez moi. Robe blonde/dorée légèrement trouble, mousse blanche persistante. Nez fruité et houblonné, banane, citron, vanille. Légère amertume, texture crémeuse, peu sucrée.Notes de banane, mangue, gingembre et malts. Fin un peu sèche sur la banane.

Bottle (765ml - what an odd size). Just hay gold with a white head that's soon a coat. Aroma light dough oranges, funky apricot, coriander, pepper. Light bodied, carbonation is moderate - a little lower than I really like with this sort of thing. Fruity with an end of summer feel - more mellow stone fruit than citrus. Hints of Viognier. Then spices and an underdone bitterness in a finish that still works because it's just about dry enough. I like that it's not trying to be anything else. Good.
One of my favorites.  It is pleasingly crisp, tart,  and a tad of funky.  It's a bit pricey, but definitely worth it.

35,5cl Bottle @ Saveur-Biere, Lille, France.
Hazy golden colour with a thin white head.
Aroma is yeast, citrus, fruits.
Taste is yeast, citrus, fruits, spices, slightly hoppy.
Medium body, average carbonation.
Tap at Annyeongyo Pub, Busan. Hazy yellow colour, small white head and lace. Riped lychee, pepper in the nose. Medium-bodied. Fruity, Saison yeasty peppery, somewhat funky. Mellow. Nice.

Aroma-8/12
Appearance-2.5/3
Flavor-16/20
Mouthfeel-5/5
Overall Impression-8/10
Total-39.5/50

风格：Saison
酒精度：6.5%vol
原麦汁浓度：14.0°P
灌装日期：2015.12.12 - Vintage 2015

饮用日期：2018.06.21
饮用温度：8.5℃-11℃

香气：明显的酸橙混合一些马厩气息，整体比较柔和，马厩气味带来一些杏子风味，轻微的谷物气息，酒花风味、酒精气息未察觉到。

外观：稻草黄、柠檬黄色，色度约4；酒体雾状浑浊，有许多气泡不断升腾；酒头洁白，厚度中等到厚实，持久度尚可，但比利时花边不明显到尚可，挂杯有时沉降较快。

风味：入口明显偏干，但苦度较温和，强度感知为中等到中等稍下，风味呈现为干草、酸橙和霉香，另外还有一些谷物（如小麦）的生面团味，收口一些酸味来平衡干苦的口感，使得收口颇为舒服；余味有淡淡霉香和一些辛香，较为持久。

口感：中等酒体，入口柔和，中等偏下到中等偏上碳酸杀口感、较细密，余味稍有一点点酒精温热、刺激感，收口时呈现的酸味平衡了干苦，带来一些清新感。

总体印象：很符合标准的一款由美国酒厂制作的比利时季节啤酒，入口Saison的干苦特征比较明显，而收口时适当的酸味又恰当地平衡了这一特点，给酒体增添了水果清爽质感和活力；除此之外，此酒酿造过程中应该引入了些许brett酵母，在陈放过程中霉香生成明显，适当的霉香可以增加口感丰富度，结合之前的体验，我建议此酒可适当陈年但不要超过三年，否则霉香太重影响Saison本身果味酯香的感受。

建议饮用温度6℃-11℃ （温度偏低时可以获得更清爽的口感，稍高时可以感受稍加丰富的酒体风味。）

Saturday, June 8, 2018. Bottle, 12 fl.oz. 6.5%. Bottled nearly 2 years ago. No best before date. Purchase ("saveur-biere", FR). Home. A yellow clear beer ; light opaque ; bubbly+ ; medium white head ; short retention. Herb, fruits (citrus, light lemon), brett floral leather woody notes. Light to medium dry refreshing sour, sweet note, light bitter, light acid. Medium body, thin texture, average gaseous, dry wild herbal finish. Overall, great !
Perfect, easy to drink, alcohol effects lowly felt, love the spicey maybe coriander ending, unique flavor, nice color and presentation.

Pretty disappointed with this one. Great reviews but I found it unimpressive. It is one dimensional. No refreshing acidity but also none of of ghe nice creaminess of a belgian ale. No belgian yeast flavors. More like a Gueuze actually but without the exotic fruit aromas....
golden, clear, white foam, medium sourness, medium body, lively, abrupt finish,

14-APR-2018, draft @Goose Island Taproom.
Hazy golden with a lasting, White head. Yeast, brett, oak, fruit. Lively carbonation, dry, nice.

Aroma is yeast, white wine, lemon, grass, orange peel. Lively carbonation and thin body. Taste is sweet, pleasantly crisp and slightly tart with hints of saison yeast, white wine and sweet lemonade. Same follows in the finish with addition of vanilla.
Bottle.  Sofie pours a hazy yellow color with a white head and nice carbonation.  The aroma has fruity and yeasty notes. The taste is tart.

I love this beer. Aroma is slight farmhouse Brett pepper but dominated by citrus orange. Crisp taste. Well attenuated but not totally drying. Saison, citrus and Brett on the pallet in that order. Only let down to me is carbonation. Nice and reasonably high but feels forced. Bubbles feel big in my mouth like in lemonade. A tighter bottle conditioned type carbonation would finish this beer perfectly.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bonne couleur bonne mousse
Arôme assez fruité
En bouche elle est assez douce, légèrement maltée, pas trop amer et une bonne longueur
C'est une bière de saison est vraiment excellente

355ml bottle 2017 vintage. Pours beautiful lightly hazy golden lifted peppery cedary notes. Palate light and fresh with grapefruit pith and peppery yeasty finish. Tartness on the back of the palate. Nice lil treat.
33cl Bottle. Nice aroma, almost no head, a bit acidic but less than expected, drinkable but meh

Zaskakująco dobre piwo. Na początek w nosie belgia, choć nie do końca typowa, bo bardzo delikatna aczkolwiek wyraźna. Jest przyprawowo, dalej miły, orzeźwiający i kwaśno słodki zapach z owocowością - jabłka, pożeczka, cytryna.

W smaku jest mega lekkie, orzeźwiajace i tu również niezwykle delikatna belgijska przyprawowość, belgijskie drożdże, kolędra, dalej lekko cytrynowy, przyjemnie i delikanie kwaskowy z leciutką owocową słodkością. Jest dobrze zbalansowane, bardzo gładkie, z niska goryczką i mega pijalnością.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty peppery citrus aroma. Fruity malty spicy yeasty peppery flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy peppery yeasty citrus finish.

355ml bottle. Milky, yellow-ish golden colour with average to huge, frothy, diminishing, minimally lacing, white head. Mild bretty bubblegum aroma, citrusy hoppy overtones, a touch of lemon and orange peel, spicy hints of white pepper, brine and dill. Taste is tart-ish, dry, citrusy and yeasty spicy, moderately bitter hoppy, zesty hints of orange, lemon, a touch of brine, dill, white pepper, minimally bready malty basis with a touch of vanilla and powder sugar; prickling carbonation. Quite rich, withal rather clean. Good.

16 Goose Island Sofie

La Brasserie Goose Island : 

L'histoire de Goose Island commence il y a près de 30 ans en 1988, quand le fondateur John Hall ouvre son premier Brewpub à Chicago. Inspiré par ses nombreux voyages en Europe, et incapable de trouver une Real Ale décente aux États-Unis, cela l'inspire pour créer sa propre brasserie.

Véritable passionné, le succès est avec lui ce qui le pousse à ouvrir sa brasserie en 1995. Depuis lors, la brasserie continue d'évoluer, offrant une liste de bières classiques pour tous les goûts qui lui a valu une place parmi les 100 meilleures brasseries dans le monde ( selon le site de références brassicoles Ratebeer ).

La Bière :

Nommée d'après la petite-fille de John Hall, Sofie est une bière de Saison réputée chez Goose Island puisque c'est une de leurs bières signature. Cette édition spéciale vieillie en fût de vin est une blonde avec une tête blanche mousseuse, nous dévoilant d'élégants arômes de malts fruités, d'orange et de levure.

Sur la langue, la carbonatation vive et le corps élancé sont d'un fruité rafraîchissant, appuyés par les zestes d'oranges et soulevant le houblon Amarillo ainsi que la levure belge classique.

S'il y a une bière conçue pour convertir les amateurs de vin Sauvignon Blanc ou Pino Grigio, cela pourrait bien être celle qu'il vous faut.

Le style :

Les bières de saison étaient à l'origine brassées en Wallonie, la région francophone de Belgique, pour les ouvriers agricoles qui ont droit à un maximum de 5 litres par jour.

Évidemment, quiconque essaye de boire 5 litres de bière par jour ne va pas être très productif pour sa journée de travail, donc ces bières étaient significativement plus faibles ( environ 3% ) que la version d'aujourd'hui.

Pâles et rafraîchissantes avec une finale sèche, les saisons proposent également des épices telles que la coriandre, le gingembre ou le zeste d'orange.

Température : 8-10 ° C

Verre : Gobelet / Teku / Tulipe

 

Accords mets et vins : Avec son merveilleux mélange acidulé et fruité, les bières de saison s'adaptent parfaitement aux plats de poissons et de crustacés. Les moules marinières aux poireaux et au vin blanc sont l'incarnation du plat idéal pour la Sofie.



Amertume 1/5
Douceur 3/5

Taste is totally the same, mild sweet & bitter, with a soury citric and vinous element, that nearly feels brett-like. This special sense makes this beer rather unique, although it also saturates in its strong presence. Rather strong carbonation. Less dry, more body and more sour than a regular saison.

18-12-2017; bottle; at home (bought at Saveur Bière, #16 of Beery Christmas 2017).
The looks of the beer are fine. Not to special, but most Saisons don't look to special. The colour of the beer is a bright yellow. The beer has a slight haziness, but it is still possible to see trough it. On top of the beer a rather thin layer of rough white, fast collapsing foam is formed. Within seconds the foam disappears, leaving nearly nothing. 
The smell of the beer is that of a Saison...very barnyard like...not entirely for me. There are some hints of malts, but they are a bit covered by the other aromas. I smell some zesty hops, but loads of spicy and barnyard yeasts. It smells a little bit like zoo to me...
The taste is comparable. Some sweet malts, bitter and slightly acidic hops, with some zesty notes, but most of the flavour is filled by yeast. Barnyard and a bit tart, with a spicy profile, including some peppery notes. Not bad, but not great either. 
The palate is avarage. Medium light body, a sticky and dry texture and medium high carbonation. The finis contains some zest, and spicy and tart yeasts. All in all, not my favourite beer, but definitely not a bad one. It doesn't seem to special to me.

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso riconosce lo speziato e il pepe bianco. L'intensità olfattiva è molto elevata e la continuità olfattiva è apprezzabile. Il cappello di schiuma resiste poco. La grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine. La carbonazione è bassa. La consistenza del liquido è limpida. La frizzantezza si manifesta sotto forma di bollicine fini. La carbonazione è abbondante, frizzante e vivace. Il colore è giallo spento. Il corpo è strutturato. L'amaro è moderato. L'intensità gustativa è elevata e la costanza gustativa è buona. Il finale è bruschino. Il retrogusto è intenso. L'aroma in bocca riporta sentori di cereali, frutta secca, chiodi di garofano, spezie e pepe bianco.

Pours copper with a little head. Lovely ginger and lemon aroma. A bit of belgian yeast in the flavour and a bit of ginger.

Rótulo estilo formal, descritivo sofisticado que so não sobressai mais pela garrafa longneck de 355ml dessa versão de 2015. Trata-se de uma 'Farmhouse Ale' (Saison de estilo belga) fruto de um 'blend' de 80% de cerveja "fresca" com 20% de cerveja maturada em barricas de carvalho usadas, em vinho branco, com raspas de Laranja. Composta com trigo, toque suaves e elegante de Amarillo que confere amargor de 20 IBU e com 6,5% ABV. 
Coloração dourada-palida, turbidez homogenea, creme alvo de média formação e boa duração. Aromas complexos e marcantes onde afloram dulçor do malte, cítricos (laranja e grapefruit?), notas de coentro e uvas. Corpo baixo, alcool quase imperceptível (apesar dos 6,5%), refrescância presente com as notas cítricas de laranja, condimento e picancia que remete a pimentas brancas, amargor taninico (remete a vinho branca espumante) e com alta carbonatação. Final ácido, conduzindo a baunilha e ligeiro secor agradável e prolongado. Conjunto elegante, delicado e sofisticado.

Garrafa de 355ml - Rio de Janeiro, Brasil - Agosto de 2017

Bottle from Hopt. Aroma is pale malt, slightly funky yeast, tart dried fruits, orange, citrus peel, floral, peppery and soft herbal notes, mild bretty, touch of wood and creamy vanilla. Robe blonde pale mousse blanche. Nez fruit, blé. Bouche épicée, légèrement acidulée. Très bonne.

Bouteille 33cl. Couleur champagne, mousse blanche ténue. Agrumes aux nez et au palais. Arômes de vin blanc, banane, poivre par moments. Final très légèrement houblonné et raffraîchissement. Manque à mon sens de caractère pour dépasser le stade de "bonne bière".

On draft at Goose Island bar at O’Hare Airport pours a hazy, golden yellow body with a thick white quickly dissipating head, although the lacing persisted. The aroma was wheat, citrus, and fruit. The flavor is citrusy and hops, some yeast and pepper spice. The mouthfeel is light. Finish is dry crisp bready tartness with a long lasting blend of citrus and yeast.
Berry Christmas #16 et découverte dans la Saveur Box. Bière jaune claire. Arômes d’épices et malt. En bouche on retrouve les épices et le style belge. Très bonne bière. Belle découverte.

Seguindo o estilo Belgian Farmhouse ale, em sua composição temos um blend com 80% de cerveja fresca e 20% de cerveja envelhecida em barris de vinho com raspas de laranja. Traz agradáveis notas cítricas, complementadas com notas picantes de pimenta branca e um aroma selvagem vindo da fermentação com brettanomyces. Junto temos casca de laranja, e um requintado acabamento seco, levemente ácido e que remete à baunilha. Temos um perfeito equilíbrio entre doçura e acidez. Sofie é produzida com três tipos de malte e uma discreta lupulagem com amarillo. Antes de ser engarrafada a cerveja descansa três meses em barris. Resumindo é uma bebida bem refrescante e excelente!

Clear Golden/orangish color with a decent head retention. A lot of effervescence inside the liquid. It smells like barnyard, tart wheat, orange. Sparkling bubbles on the tongue, light to medium acidity, pretty dry, the bretts ate every sugars they could, light bitterness, lemon. Very good farmhouse saison, not too much barnyard and leather side it’s more subtle.

Having fumbled the ball with the Urban Wheat debacle, Goose Island come back strongly with this. 330 ml bottle served cold in a small chalice. Satsumas and wheat aroma. Beautiful golden body, but the head fades quickly. However, this is about the flavours. Orange cream, spicy bananas, hard cheese, long spicy citrus finish. Delicious.
765 ml bottle. Hazy pale yellow colour, white head. Aroma of citrus, tart apples, malt and spices. The flavour is fruity, slightly sweet, with citrus, spices and notes of white wine. Very tasty.

Type: 16-oz. draft 
Glass: Goose Island chalice
From: Goose Island Pub at Hard Rock Casino in Las Vegas, Nev. 
Price: $8.00
Purchased: Dec. 14, 2016
Consumed: Dec. 14, 2016
Reviewed as: Saison / Farmhouse Ale
Misc.: N/A

Was staying at the Hard Rock for a work trip and had planned on heading to the Goose Island Pub once I saw that BCBS was on tap. The plan was to review Sofie and Matilda, and have a BCBS. However, once I got there I was told that they ran out of BCBS in the last hour. Bummer. Still wanted to try both beers and was actually surprised that I had not yet.

Poured a straw-gold yellow clear color with 1-to-2 fingers of frothy white head when I got it. Lots of bubbles coming up from the bottom of the glass. Good spotty lacing. Outstanding retention. (Sight - 4.00)

Smelled rather boozy up front. Settled in and got lemon, coriander peel, citrus zest, white wine (could not pick out which type) barrels, grassy notes, lingering peppery spices and dry apricot. (Smell - 3.75)

Taste was much better, getting lemon juice, bitter coriander peel, hints of boozy oaky white wine, but not overwhelming, grassy nots, some tartness, a touch of banana and still that dry apricot. (Taste - 4.25)

Light body. Oily texture. Lively carbonation. Dry, citrusy finish. (Feel - 4.00)

This was a really good beer. Better than I thought I would be. (Overall - 4.00)

4.04 90 A-

Bottle bought in San Francisco. Pours golden with fast-settling head and a very faint haze. Aromas of lemony funk with hints of pineapple and melon. Body is lightly lemony-tart, dry-sweet and dry-grassy bitter, more Bretty farmyard, complex yet clean, almost *too* distinctively Farmhouse, but very tasty. Re-rate a 2017 bottle, fruity-dry body with funky-bitter overtones and a sweet finish.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer&Beyond, Tel Aviv. Hazy yellow with white head. The aroma has lots of flowers, yeasty and perfumed with some funk, spicy. Sourish and bitterish flavor, spicy with lots of flowers, perfumed, citrus, white wine, dry. Medium to full-bodied. Very nice.

Over all, a very satisfactory beer. Isn’t too strong in the alcohol content, allowing more servings to be enjoyed when dining or out within a social atmosphere. Has a nice fruity, sweet like taste and a smooth intake that is astounding. Definitely recommend this one for anyone who wants to take their beverage up a few notches.
La más fina entre las Saisons que he probado. Casi más un champagne que otra cosa. Una table beer en toda regla

Slightly hazy golden pour with thin cap of white. Aroma hints of lemon, slight funk and maybe a touch of candi sugar. Flavor is similar with some light sour notes of citrus, and a decent malt sweetness. Nothing about this beer is overly dominant. Very tasty and very balanced with a slightly tart finish. One of the best I’ve tried for the style.

Draught. Pours a hazy light orange with a bubbly to lacy off white head. Aroma is of pepper, orange, citrus, biscuit. Taste is of orange, lemon, pepper, biscuit, clove. Hard to detect the wine barrel ageing. Oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

0,355l bottle at home from trade with fabiand, big thanks. Bottled 04 April 2016. yellow clear shiny color, small white head. smells of brett, light barnyard, lightly leathery, citric, light ripe fruits, lightly vinous, nice smell. medium to full body, rather bubbly carbonation, soft mouthfeel. tastes of brett, light sweetness, a bit musty, some ripe fruits, spices, lightly yeasty, a bit grassy. finishes rather dry with light brett, spices and light sweetness. liked the smell quite a bit, taste is rather boring though. overall nice beer though.

On draft at AB (yep, judge away). Mild, slightly apricot aroma. Pours clear golden, moderate carbonation just enough to make it crisp. Doughy initially with apple notes but slightly musty finish, which is what takes this beer down a notch for me.

Poured from 12 oz. bottle. Yeast, a bit of farmhouse funk, orange peel, with a hint of citrus. Nice mouthfeel and aftertaste. This would be a great brew for the non-beer drinker or those looking to get into the craft beer world. Not particularly fond of Saisons, but this one tastes fantastic.
12oz bottle. Somewhat cloudy golden pour. Aroma is orange peel with some funk. The white pepper really come through in the taste, balances nice with the citrus. Nice dry finish. Really well done.

On tap no bar da Goose Island (chicago) out/16:

Cerveza color ámbar turbio. Con aromas cítricos a Lima, y cáscara de naranja. Al paladar se perciben notas cítricas intensas con toque de naranja y al final con un ligero sabor a fermentación que perdura. Cerveza agradable y fresca. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
De geur is lekker fruitig. De kleur troebelblond met een mooie schuimkraag. De smaak is ook lichtfruitig, maar het hinderd niet. Een goed biertje.

Bottle poured into a pilsner showing well filtered neon yellow with half a finger of clean white foam. 

The nose shows a lot of clean lemon zest, orange peel, and sweet bready malts. 

The palate is medium bodied and well carbonated. Moderately tart with flavors of light lemon and hints of orange. Light Belgian yeast influence apparent throughout. Excellent example of a saison.

Bottle. Hazy yellow with a large frothy white head. Citrus, brett, leather, barnyard, minerals and vanilla in the nose. Flavour follows: Brett, barnyard, leather, wood, citrus, grapes and vanilla. Medium body, fizzy carbonation, thin texture, medium sweet with balanced bitterness. Somewhat fizzy and overly dominated by citrus, kind of like a bretty wit.
Great example of a saison. Slightly tart with a touch of lemon and lemon peel. Didn’t get orange peel but there was a light cracker/malt flavor and a little hops. Refreshing.

Draft @ Oblivion. Pours s clear golden beer with a small bubbly white head on top. Aroma of peppery saison yeast, light funky notes, grainy touches. Flavor is typical saison done good, nice light acidic notes, loads of funky saison funk, bready notes with a more sweet malty aftertaste. Carbonation is medium high. Nice and decent.

At Fifth street brewpub. Initial tang of wild yeast and orange peel. A hint of lemon and citrus. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

765ml bottle. Pours a hazy golden blonde, with a small white head, which lasts well and leaves decent lacing. The aroma offers white wine, a little vanilla oak and some funky notes. Funky tartness up front mixes with a little oak, before leading into fruity orange and white wine in the mid-palate. It finishes crisp and spicy. A nice, complex saison.
Draft. Pours hazy blonde. The palate is full body and sweet. The taste is grassy and fruity. Great saison

The best saison I have had so far. Appears in the class a slightly hazy sunshine gold color with a pillowy clean white head. The aroma is lemon and yeast with a trace of orange peel. The mouthfeel is velvety and light with a bit of a bite from the carbonation. The flavors are tart lemon and orange balanced out by rich doughy yeast. Lighter notes of pepper and vanilla take place at the end.

Aroma is tangy floral, lemon, orange.... complex. Appearance is hazy yellow with large frothy white head. Taste is orange lemon forward with a sweet malt. Floral with some hop bitterness... almost Belgian. Palate is medium light. Overall a nice beer.Tangy and enjoyable. Not exactly unique but fun and a nice beer.
Some citrusy hops and lots of belgian yeast flavour, fairly bright a bit fruity, golden and sparkling, medium body, nice and a bit creamy.

Sampled on draught at the Hopsmith Tavern, Chicago. Pale yellow with a white head. Very fruity flavour with lots of orange taste and a green apple tartness. Hints of peach and champagne. Dry finish. Very easy drinking with an appealing sweetness offset by a fruity tartness. This is a highly drinkable Saison.

Sampled again In June 2019, this time from a bottle from Clapton Craft in Kentish Town. This is a very good beer and I have added one point to my previous review.

Aroma is Sauvignon blanc, Brett, wheat, corn. Appearance is pale yellow, initial pour is crystal clear. Very active bubbles. Taste: white pepper, wheat, hay, champagne, barnyard funk. Palate is thin bodied and quite effervescent. Finishes slightly dry. Overall an enjoyable farmhouse saison that isn’t exorbitantly expensive.
Aroma is sparkling champagne. Taste is sweet citrus. Overall just an OK one.

12oz bottle. Pours pale yellow with a large foamy white head. Aroma is floral, yeasty, and full of pear. Taste is lightly tart with lemon, orange, pear, and some grapefruit. Some pepper. Pleasant traces of yeast.  Dry, white wine like finish.  Light body.  Somewhat above average carbonation.
Slight sour aroma with a Belgian yeast body adorned with peppercorn bit of a champagne like finish.

Veiled golden color with extra powerful champagne like amount of activity. Extra frothy beige 4 finger sparkly island head, lasting around 15-20 minutes, with strong legs.

Aromas of white wine and champagne, yeast and fresh flowers. Flavors of apple, green grapes, pears, floral and herbal spices. Perfect balance of sweetness and sharpness.

Oily light body with champagne like carbonation. Light and short finish, ending with a vinous cider like green grapes fruity feel.

Overall exquisitely well crafted : delicious subtle but complex flavors, super fresh and tender, perfect sexy body, great balance and well intensifed, ideal accessible light appertizer.
Bottle. Pues cloudy yellow with high head. Aims is Belgian yeast, Finnish Sahti, coriander. Taste is sour, malts, lemon peel. Nice.

Doughy yeast in the nose and a touch of saline and citrus notes. Pours slightly cloudy, pale yellow, with quick white foam. Saline / tart notes in the taste, ester yeasts, and some orange citrus. The citrus persists to the end. Mild spice notes, some pepper and coriander. Medium body and light fizz. A touch of hoppy bitterness and a good, dry finish.

Many samples over the last several years, mostly in bottles but most recently on draught at Café Hollander in Madison, WI (early July 2016). Big lasting head tops an oily, lightly cloudy amber body...fairly sharp grapefruit-lemon and peppery nose, some fragrant light malts in there too as it warms, a hint of dry farmy yeast...peppery-spicy throughout on the tongue, lightly sweet in the middle of the palate, just a touch syrupy at first but drying out quite a bit towards the finish, which is tart and cidery...moderate to slightly strong carbonation, fairly full. This was better than recent small bottles I’ve had; the first (750ml) bottles I consumed in, oh, 2010/11 or so were better still I think, a bit more funky and full and dry. Still pretty solid on draught I think, but at this point I probably prefer Matilda.

Barnyard, grain and cereal malts, yeast, some sour fruits. Hazy, pale gold, medium, frothy, white head. Light bitter. More yeasty grains, some tart, fairly fruity, light spices, soft carbonation. Very solid Saison, well-balanced and complex. Keg at the brewery tap room, Chicago.

This little bottle held much more than I expected. I don’t give 5 stars off handed. I poured from the bottle. Nice hazy lemon yellow in color with a suitable head and perfect amount of carbonation. The clean scent comes straight up and that’s about the only way I can describe it...clean. Very, very easy to drink with a slightly sweet, honey end. I don’t normally like a citrus flavor but the vanilla sweetness keeps the citrus in check yet allows refreshing balance it it all comes together from the first sip to the last drink.

Pours pale yellow with a thin white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma a lemon, grapefruit, pear and yeast. Flavours are citrus, floral and wheat. The high carbination takes away from the flavours a bit but all in a very good beer.

I normally don’t drink beer, but I think I’ve found the perfect "girly" beer I can stand. Great aroma, great on the palette . It almost has a champagne feel, which makes it much lighter than most beers .

http://www.lifejunkee.com/the-girliest-beer-ever/
Bottle, 2016--straw color with medium carbonation and a small, white head. The aroma is sour pear. Light malt flavor with some citrus on the dry finish. Not very tart at all. Total Wine.

Tart lemony biscuity aroma with cherry and pepper.
Pours a very hazy yellow golden color with small creamy head
Tart lemony cherry flavor, light leather barnyard funk, bready, yeasty peppery.
Medium light bodied with medium co2, lingering pleasant yeasty sweet finish. 
After a long hot day this is very good. Interesting and refreshing. I wouldn't mind drinking this until I pass out. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear light gold with a short lived small white head, loads of bubbles! A very lively beer. A great mix of Belgian yeast with bubblegum sweetness balanced by barnyard dankness, old wet hay, good sour funk. Crisp & refreshing, zesty, there’s a bit of spice and citrus, a very nice choice (pun intended) for a warm humid night.

What a great beer! Fuck the complainers about goose island-this is fantastic.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From tap at Beelovers Bar. Lightly sour aroma, but still a lot of fresh saison character. Slight bitter finish.

Tap at Beerlovers bar . Pours unclear blonde. Small white head. Smell is intense, oak, grape, some sourness. Mild wine. Taste is Sharp, fruity. Less sour than expected. Even a bit sweet. Rather dry. Ok

Sample from bottle in front of ’Bierkoning’ during Carnivale Brettanomyces 2016
 Sofie, Belgian Style Farmhouse Ale, pours yellow/golden with a white head. Aroma of malts, hay, straw, lemon, saison herbs, citrus, Taste of citrus, lemons, orange, grass, malts, straw, saison herbs, pepper, malts, fresh, pretty sweet, balanced, quite nice.

Draft at brett fest. Aroma of dry yeast, , malt and esters. Taste of sweet yeast, esters, dry yeast and some sweetness. Typical saison actually.
On tap at Old Town Pour House. Crisp and clean taste. Mildly yeasty taste. Pours a clear golden with white lacing.

Clara dourada,translúcida,espuma fina com baixa manutenção;no aroma e no sabor o frutado se destaca,apresentando frutas amarelas(pêssego,manga) acompanhado de uma leve acidez remetendo a uvas brancas;notas condimentadas e cítricas acompanham,corpo médio,álcool praticamente não é percebido,refrescante,alta "drinkability". Ótima cerveja,elegante e deliciosa.

A 12 fl oz bottle bottled on 16th December 2015 and poured into a Cantillon ballon glass. It poured a slightly cloudy champagne gold colour with a one finger white head that dissipated fairly quickly but left some sparse lacing. Aromas are strong orange peel, juicy orange, lemon and white grape. Light funkiness with a hint of mango. Tastes a juicy mix of orange and lemon with a hint of mango. Light tartness, some peppery spice notes and a hint of bread on the finish. Light to medium bodied with moderate to high spritzy carbonation. Overall a great solid saison with nice juicy citrus notes. Very refreshing on a hot day.

Bottle shared at the Goose Japan launch. Lemon and yogurt on the nose with some light grassy hops and crackery malts. Good yeast character as well. Clean and fairly crisp on the palate. Well-balanced with those crackery malts working well with the lemony tartness. Dry finish with a little vanilla that lingers. Not bad at all.
Excellently done farmhouse with a little funk. Bottle at a bar. could have drank it all night.
Cerveza con estilo tipo vino blanco espumoso, qué logra un sabor complejo y notas de lúpulo suave.

500ml bottle from The Perfect Pour, labelled 2015. Pours a pale yellow with a thin white head. Aroma is crisp, lemon, yeast, pepper. Taste is citrus, very clean and fresh, a little tart and sweet, not bitter at all.
Tap @ Hoppy Loft, Brussels 20160507. Fruity, yeasty and light spicy, citrusy with vanilla notes. The finish is dry and fruity with spicy notes.
饮用于北京本垒鹅岛派对。 外观：浅金色酒体，略浑浊，泡沫丰富，但消失很快。 气味：明显的橙子香气，适中的酸味，酒花香，不太强但明显的野生酵母，非常清新。 味道：酸度适中偏低，橙子味，较明显的香草，酒花的较轻的苦味。口感：二氧化碳带来的较强沙口感，收口干，生津。很好喝的比利时塞森。
Pours a bright golden yellow with fizzy head. Aromas of tropical fruits and some citrus peel. Funky orange/lemon peel flavors with a nice woody funk.
Cerveja com aroma cítrico. Cerveja bem encorpada com aroma e gosto cítrico. Extremamente harmoniosa, com equilíbrio perfeito entre amargor, corpo e cor. Uma das melhores cerveja que já tomei
Tap @ delirium hoppy loft. Pours a golden colour beer with a medium head. Citrusy with some hops and spices, refreshing. Dry finish.

bottle @ Party Town / Florence KY --- (2015 bottle) Aroma of malt and light sour. Slightly hazy light amber, white head that slowly drops to a cover, bands of lace. Taste is light malt that adds medium carbonation, a spritz of citrus sour, a little orange and, deep in the finish, a little vanilla. Refreshing, light, palate cleansing, super with homemade pizza.

Servida en copa Goose Island Sofie. APARIENCIA: de color pajizo, bastante pálida, se observa ligeramente turbia y moderada actividad de carbonatación; corona de espuma color blanco, de baja retención, de burbujas compacta.

AROMA: notas cítricas, cáscara de naranja, notas ligeramente agrias pero no agresivas, se lleva a apreciar notas vinosas de los barriles.

SABOR: de entrada las notas cítricas hacen presencia, cáscara de naranja, seguido de notas ácidas/agrias que van acorde al estilo, no son nada agresivas, también se aprecian notas vinosas muy ligeras; el retrogusto queda un amargor muy ligero, seco y nada astringente, y en garganta un sensación de calidez que no es agresiva, si no refrescante.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo ligero, carbonatación media alta.
RESUMEN: Excelente cerveza representante del estilo, con cierto grado de complejidad.

Pretty clear straw color, light white head. Lemon, citrus, light hay, floral. Sweet, light sour, almost no bitterness. Chewy, lighter body, light acidity. Good.

12 oz. bottle. Pour is hazy gold with a white head. Moderate to high carbonation. Aroma of lemon, fruits, and spice. Similar taste. Mildly tart. Quite refreshing.

Aroma: fruity and hoppy; very promising; Appearance: hazy golden-orange straw with good carbonation; white head that dissipates fairly slowly; Taste: more subtle than my previous saisons; not overwhelmingly tart or sour; Palate: medium body with long, dry, slightly sweet finish; Overall: very pleasant and smooth; would be good with fish or chicken; would buy again.

Où, Quand, Comment : 
Bouteille, dégustée le 6/07/2014. 




Visuel :  
Couleur : jaune. 
Apparence : légèrement voilée. 




Arôme :  
Levures fruitées (agrumes, notes de poires) et aux notes épicées, grains de malt pâle, léger de houblon herbeux et floral avec des petites notes rustiques et vineuses. 




Goût :  
En entrée de bouche : Goût de levures fruitées (agrumes, notes de poires et de pêches) et légèrement épicées (poivre doux) ainsi qu’avec des petites notes rustiques.
Un support de malt pâle légèrement sucré et de pain est également présent avec de faibles traces boisées (vineux) et de vanille ainsi qu’avec une légère amertume de houblon floral et herbeux.




En bouche :  

Corps : moyen-mince.
Effervescence : moyenne.
Texture : petites notes crémeuses.
Finale : moyenne et sèche, composée d’un goût de levures fruitées (zeste d’agrumes) aux notes épicées avec une légère amertume de houblon herbeux.

Draft 0.15l at Tap takeover Goose Island at The Beer Temple Amsterdam Netherlands.19.03.2016.Taste with Potjebier and Zlotta.Pour it hazy yellow color with small white head.Aroma of lemon,zesty,refreshing.Taste of coriander,lemony,lemon zest,some lime also,reall refreshing,nice balanced,dry on the back and at the end.Nice pleasent after taste also.Good.
The aroma is funky and sour. The appearance is hazy gold. The taste is like the aroma and a bit buttery. The palate is average. Overall complex.

Bottle from the LCBO. 2014 version that I am just getting to. Slightly cloudy pale yellow with a large white head that recedes gradually to a sheet and leaves sparse lace. Nose is orange peel, white wine, lemon, yeast, light honey, pepper, wheat and a good dose of funk. Flavour is medium tart with a light honey sweetness and a moderate pepper. Mouth is slightly thin with prickly carbonation and a very dry finish. Many interesting layers.

8/4-/7+/4-/16-
Tap at BeerTemple, 23rd March 16. Pours clear, aroma is fresh and fruity. Taste is clean, refreshing, citrus, some yeast. Very enjoyable.

Tart taste with lemon and herbs.
Classic saison aroma. Yeast funk shines through. Golden with thick head. Hazy. Classic saison but kinda bland. I wish they fermented at higher temps. But it’s inbev ... whadaya expect haha

Sampled from tap at ’Beertemple’. Clear, pale golden yellow with a white head. Fruity-grassy, slightly funky aroma of lemon peel, straw, dandelion and some gooseberry. Sweetish, fruity-grassy, slightly funky taste of lemon peel, ginger, dandelion and some gooseberry, followed by a short, slightly bitter, dry-grassy finish. Thin to medium body, slightly spritzy mouthfeel, flat. Nice!

Amarelo palha, levemente turva, espuma de boa formação e pouca persistência, aspecto cremoso. Aroma frutado de laranja, brett, especiarias. Paladar de leve dulçor e amargor. Corpo leve e média carbonatação. Final laranjado, seguindo bem o aroma.

Keg at The White Horse, Parson’s Green as ’Goose Island Sofie’. £7.50 a pint. Hazy dark yellow, lightly sparkling, small foamy white head. Aroma is bubblegum, wheaty ester. Body is light, tingly carbonation, a bit foamy. Taste is more bubblegum, estery, blueberry, some soap, some thin jelly and gummy bears, spicy finish. It’s a bit thin and plain, not fussed on the body. Could take it or leave it.

Aroma: farmhouse, belgian phenols, peach, zesty.
Appearance; clear golden color and white head.
Taste: sour, farmhouse, zesty, belgian phenols, semi-dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carboantion, zesty finish.
Overall: Really nice farmhouse notes, drinkable.

2015 BJCP Category: 25B Saison


AROMA: Orangepeel, white grape, general farm quality. Lemonade quality. Estery. 9/12

APPEARANCE: Definitely right color, but very small head with no lacing or retention. 1/3

FLAVOR: Light orange peel, plenty of white grape. Some tartness on the finish. Spice fades quickly. Becomes more dry and tart. Some honey wheat flavor. Tame for the style, but interesting. 13/20

MOUTHFEEL: Undercarbonated for the style. Light body. Tepid, watery mouthfeel. Some alcohol warmth. Should be much more bubbly 2/5

OVERALL IMPRESSION: A fine beer and additional wine barrel is creative. Not a great example of the saison style, though. Amazing that a fresh bottle is so mild. Probably better considered Belgian Blonde. 6/10

TOTAL SCORE: 31/50
Bottle from Craigs, dregs run. Pours clear golden with a thin white head. Aromas of hay, grassy, bread. Taste is lemon, white pepper, thin finish.
Pours clear golden yellow with no head. Aroma is herbal and citrus. Taste is citrus, slight herbal, peppers.
Bottle at craig’s. Pours clear golden, nose is funky, lime, little pissy, taste is dry, funky, sour, fruity.

Aroma is funk, slight tart, barnyard, slight banana and clove, wet hay. Appearance is straw yellow, hazy, white head. Taste is funky barnyard, hay, tart, slight banana that is fading with warmth, orange peel. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, crisp, effervescent carbonation, dry, a bit of that funk hanging around. Overall, this is a very well done Saison.

765ml bottle. Golden-yellow in colour with a long lasting white head, good lacing. The aroma is of lemons, some spice, yeast, grassy, green grapes. The flavour is of yeast, lemons, grass, some wood, some light pepper. Lightly bitter mouthfeel, medium/light body, moderate carbonation. Finishes long, citrusy and yeasty. This is nice. Good funk, lots of grapes and lemons. A well crafted Saison.

Friday after work trip to the LCBO brings home this beauty. Fantastic saison that offers: herbal hops, pear cider richness, lemon pepper spicing, citrus goodness & some white grapes from the barrel. Crisp finish makes this a great first beer of the night & I imagine this unshared 750 ml bottle is going down faster than the Republican Party in the November election. Mrs Tiki steals a sip & says its quite good & she hates beers (except authentic Belgians for some odd reason).
Draft at Brodys. Hazy golden pour with a medium head. Nose is fruit, funk. Flavor follows with a tart finish. Very fresh, enjoyable, even though it’s not my preferred style.

De Cerveceria Goose Island(E.U.A) "Sofie" una Belgian Farm House o estilo Saison según a quien se le pregunte. Este estilo es originario de los graneros franceses y belgas, se caracteriza por utilizar diversas maltas según sea la producción de temporada va desde maíz, centeno, avena o trigo, tienden a suplantar el sabor y carácter del lúpulo con hierbas aromáticas de todo tipo y son fermentadas con una levadura belga bastante agresiva en el sabor.

Esta es una cerveza de baja retención de espuma brillante, de perlas medianas, corona ligera, poca actividad de carbonatación pero un muy buen lazo que se va impregnando en el vaso, un color amarillo brillante de cuerpo medio a ligero. Sofie muestra un aroma cítrico, cascara de naranja y un toque agrio, secundariamente se libera un olor a grano de malta, no detecto si cuenta con adjuntos por las notas de especiado de la levadura, olor a fruta fermentada parecido a la sidra. Ya en el paladar la primer nota es un sabor ácido y agrio, sabor a cascara de naranja, especiado a pimienta, discreto olor a azucar y frutas, el final es ligeramente seco lo que la hace bastante refrescante. Contiene 6.5% de alcohol, si no se conoce este estilo se podría pensar que tiene diferentes faltas sin embargo todos estos tonos, sabores y especias se permiten en las Farm House.
Pours hazy pale yellow with big white head. Aroma of oranges, yeast, light barnyard. Tart, citric, light bitter. Light body, lively carbonation, refreshing. Excellent saison.

Funky citrus floral aroma in a straw pour. Flavor is smooth, subtle, full, complex, and fruity - with a crisp clean finish that leaves one wanting another. Definitely a champagne of beers (and one my partner says is the best beer she has tasted).

Pours a thick, white, medium lasting head. Body is light to medium, hi carbonation, of a orangish yellow colour and very hazy.
The aroma is of mediun intensity, with esters and a bit of orange zest.
Tastes of sweet tropical fruits, light tartness, light bitterness and freshness.
Very fresh, great for those hot days.

Smells very very sweet with citrus

Pours a hazy gold with head that disapperas quickly.

Taste is very sweet. Almost a mix between a tradition belgian ale and a wheat beer.

Great carbonation. No aftertaste.

Overall I was very happy, but probably wouldn’t go out of my way to purchase again.

Delicious, light, sparkling. Smooth citrus, vanilla. But so smooth and sparkling. Feels like I should be drinking this in a field in southern France.

Tried about a week ago at the beginning of a long night of food and drink. Bottled aged about 18 months. I remember lots of saison yeast, mild farmhouse funk, clean, light grain. Don't remember much citrus. Champagne carbo/mouthfeel. Nice stuff.

Nice unique beer from goose. Nice hazy yellow appearance. Citrus orange aroma with hint of pepper. Nice little change of pace
