1/10/16 Chicago (765 ML 2015 Bottle, poured into a tulip glass). Nice bright golden pour, slight white head. Pleasant yeast and orange aroma. Taste of chardonnay, orange and lemon. Mild carbonation, very smooth texture and easy going down. Dry, somewhat tart, enjoyable beer.

Another great offering by Goose Island!

On tap at Cork ’n’ Keg, Raymond, NH in tulip glass. Aroma is Belgian yeast with fruity esters. Appearance is hazy pale yellow with finger-width white foamy head that with only fair retention and mild lacing. Taste is largely as aroma with mix of sweet fruitiness and tart--definitely a champagne-like quality. Palate is light-to-medium bodied with thin texture, soft carbonation and dry, tart finish--very reminiscent of champagne. Overall, a slight variation on a straight saison--not earth-shatteringly different, but enough to notice.
sofie sabor freso toques frutales y citricos, un sabor muy agradable al paladar con toque de naranja

Pro estilo dela é uma boa cerveja. Mas não é um estilo que me agrada. Não vale tomar novamente. Custa 40 reais no emporio Ambev. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Medium head with fruity aroma. Smooth texture with orange peel tones. Overall a nice drink.

2015 version on tap at the Kinsale, 12/23/15.
Gently hazy, soft gold body has a small white head that fades to cover/ring.
Citrus juice, vanilla, light earthiness and peppery notes from the yeast, followed by a good deal more malt character. Probably a bit heavy-handed in that regard. Odd plaster (not in the good way) and light, dried glue. Not much going on wild yeast-wise. Perhaps the brett character hasn’t had time to emerge, which is too bad, because it could badly use some brighter, more varied, yeast notes.
In the mouth, wow has this gone downhill over the years. Where this used to be lightly sweet with soft spice character and a more delicate malt and yeast interplay, I’m left scratching my head and wondering if I’m just drinking a Hoegaarden. Granted, there’s a little bit more going on than that, but not by much. Sweet malt, with less than an impressive carbonation/texture seems to drown the spices and you’re left with citrus and pepper soaking in sugar. Light astringency and an odd vanillin character. Nothing offensive here, really, just nothing particularly interesting/good going on.  Thank god Matilda hasn’t taken such a downturn....(yet??)

Big Bottle 2013 (yes I know I shouldn’t keep these beers so long)
What a beer, an original American Saison that reminds me of my months in southern Belgium 3 decades ago.
And remembrance of this beer tapped at the Clybourn pub when she first surfaced.
So two years hasn’t dented the aroma flavor or grandness of this simple yet exquisite offering from a brewer, despite it’s present owner’s reputation, carry’s many similarities to beers from "back home."
Enjoy it now or in the future, Cheers/beers!

Christmas Eve Crispy Wings and Family Beer Tasting. Aroma is very light funk, floral spice, something fruity...maybe light grape must or apple skins. Taste is light yeasty / funky / apple juice that build up some nice floral coriander, vanilla and gets a tad bitter at the end. Better than expected!

A good farmhouse ale has the right amount of funk without being over constrixting

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sample at Leuven Innovation Beer Festival.
Poured clear gold blond, white foam head.
Hoppy, orange, grapefuit, spices in the aroma.
Taste is soft, mild, grain, mango, grapefruit.
Mildly fizzy, balanced aftertaste. Leaves the hunger for more.

675ml bottle from LCBO. 6.5% alc.vol. pours a clear gold colour with two finger of lasting white head. Aroma of grapefruit and some caramel. Taste matches the aroma. Citrus flavour is pronounced. Light body with lively carbonation. I don’t taste the typical Belgian flavours tho. Excellent farhouse ale.
Sofie is exactly what I expect from a saison. You can immediately taste the spices that you’d expect from a saison, but its finish is so smooth that you know you’re drinking something special.

Clear yellow body with a foamy white head. Aroma of grass and yeast. Taste is fruity with orange and a nice sweetness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It pours a light golden with a full white head. It is somewhat hazy and does produces lacing as the head disappears. It has a lemon fruit aroma with moderate spiciness and notes of pepper. There are also aromas of sourness and hints of orange. It’s initial flavor is of high fruit sweetness highlighted by orange and topped with spices including notes of pepper. There are also hints of lemon and tartness. It has a light moderate feel with light bitterness and a dry finish.

(Goose Island Sofie) Bottle 750 ml from Dranken Geers, served into a big tulip at home, ABV 6.5%
Bright, sunny yellow colour on the body, with a tall and thin white head, with goo retention.
Aroma of grass, saison yeast, peppery notes, citrus.
Nice taste, citrus, lemon flowers, grass, clean taste.
Medium body, good amount of carbonation.
Nice and refreshing, and highly drinkable.

Rating #1326 -15.11.2014 - Bottle from Labatt guy. 6.5% Pours a hazy straw colour with a frothy white head, not much lacing. Aroma is of farmhouse yeast. Clean mouthfeel, medium carbonation, medium alcohol warmth. Taste is a crisp sweetness, tempered with herbal notes, mild sourness from the yeast. Pretty pleasant saison.
Nice Belgium beer, citrus and sweet complexity. Yet this is still a Belgium beer that is not worth buying again

Bottle at home. Pours pale straw, very slight haze. Copious, fast-receding white head. Grapefruit and green apple on the nose. Very slight hint of something funky, but not unpleasant. Flavor is sharp, more apple, some citrus. Slight sweetness develops throughout, resolving with a tart, crisp finish. Thin mouthfeel, high carbonation. Refreshing, very pleasing and drinkable.
Bottle. Pours golden yellow with a green tint. Nice head that disappears quick. Taste great. Nice mouth feel.
Hazy yellow, thick bubbly head. Musty fruit aroma. Crisp, sweet with tangy finish. Lively in mouth.
(bottle) hazy, bright yellow colour with a tall white head; aroma of champagne, spice; balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish

Bottle from Dranken Geers, Oostakker, Nr Gent, Belgie, consumed at Isobels, Eardisley, Herefordshire, Saturday 31st October 2015.  Looks lovely and spritzy on the pour, lovely clean, zippy bubbles. Aroma fresh but also Belgian, clean, a touch of spice and orange peel. This is fresh in the mouth also, a seriously confident, classy beer. I like it but a big bottle on my own after a few beers was hard going. A7 A4 T8 P4 Ov15 3.8

A soft, spicy dough, accented with light oranges and with a gentle nudge of wine grapes. The light honey brew cascades into the glass and a soapy white head rises to two fingers above the surface.The aroma is mirrored in the flavor and the carbonation is as delicate as the rest of the experience. Refined and elegant and even the finish screams class. Very nice. I’ll be happy to open another when the need for a subtle nightcap.

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey. Clear golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of herbs, citrus, light spice, light vinegar. Tastes of light oak, citrus, floral, grassy notes, citrus peel. Medium-light body with a dry finish.
Bottle. Hazy, golden color with a medium head. Aroma is slightly fruity with a slightly funk smell. Taste is like a fruity champagne with a tast finish.

Bottle. Poured a cloudy bright yellow with medium fluffy white head. Aroma of citrus, grass, straw, funk, spice. Flavor was tart and funky, straw, light citrus, and a slight hint of the pepper spice. Medium body and a creamy texture to it. Lively carbonation and a tart dry finish. Solid beer.

12oz. bottle, pours a pale gold color, light fluffy head which dissipates leaving light lacing, taste is light citrus, probably more lemon than anything, great effervescence and a sweet finish. Very nice saison!

Bottle, shared at Brewda 2015, thanks to whoever. Pale blonde color. White head. Aroma’s: moderate sour, bretty. Retronasal there’s sourness, brett, light sweetness as well. Flavor is moderate sour, moderate sweet. Medium bodied. Quite nice actually, despite the brett.
Retry at Carnivale Brettanomyces 2016, bottle. No signs of brett at all, typical aroma and flavor of a witbier actually. Nice enough.

Bottle to goblet. Bright yellow, lacy head. Aroma is mild yeast, lemon, Orange. Taste has some apple character, touch of the Belgian wild yeast, but ok, lemon late. Feel is smooth and Very bubbly. Nice beer, though I think a slight step down from the Matilda.

Appearance: hazy pale straw with one finger of loose white head, good retention and patchy lacing. (4/5) Aroma: apple and stone fruit, lemon zest, white pepper and clove, light tropical fruit. (8/10) Taste: mild sweet, moderate bitter, mild peppery spice, mild tart. (8/10) Palate: light body, lively to moderate carbonation, off-dry short duration finish. (5/5)

A solid saison marred only slightly by a hint of brown apple in the flavour. The head and lacing could stand to be a little prettier, too. Still a very good example of the style, though! (18/20)
Citrus forward, banana, lots of crisp apple and light pepper balance out the Belgian yeast. Really tasty yet delicate beer. An actual champagne of beer.

Draft at NWIPA

A: Cloudy gold, thin white head.

N: Clove, esters, banana, unripe peach, touch of lemon, white peppercorn, orange peel, white wine grape.

T: Tart, sweet, and a little bit spicy. 

M: Light body, a bit sticky, no alcohol presence, crisp carbonation.

O: Very good saison. It sickens me to say it, but one of the best American versions I have had. It’s deep and complex.

Nice foamy head with heavy carbonation and foggy body. Aroma of soft yeast with just a hint of wit funk and citrus. Flavour is a very nice citrus with barnyard yeast. Soft oily finish. A very fine beer, nicest new world saison I’ve tasted in a long time.

Draft at Claude Hopper's. Pale yellow, clear and bubbly with very thin head. Aroma of citrus and spice. Tart, peppery flavor. Not bad.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sampled from bottle @ Leuven Innovation Beer Festival. Clear pale yellow color, small white head. Smell and taste lightly malts, hayish, lemongrass, citrussy. Refreshing. Nice one.

An absolute delight and the epitome of the style. Clean, golden yellow color. Coriander, bananas on the nose. Medium bodied. Taste was sweet, estery, a hair spicy at times with a delicate finish/bubblegum notes.
Draught. Hazy golden yellow with small creamy whitish head, vanilla aroma, medium carbonation, slightly sweet taste with Belgian yeast flavor, smooth dry finish. Very good brew.

This is my first rating, and, without a doubt, my favorite beer. (Hence the overall rating of 20.) Sofie has a refreshing, sparkling, semi-sweet taste that is unique and never gets old. I start most evenings with Sofie. Try it, you’ll like it.
Bottle. Pours a nearly clear light orange. Aroma and taste are citrus, tropical fruits, and lightly sweet.

Butelka75cl. 
OCZY : piwo ma kolor jasnej żółci z odcieniami złota. Przejrzyste o średniej wielkości pianie. 

NOS : piwo ma bardzo świeży aromat gdzie na pierwszy plan się rzuca morela, białe winogrona i czerwone jabłko. Aromat słodowy jest podobny do słodkiego biszkopta posypanego cukrem. Typowe aromaty brettów nie są intensywne ale wyczuwalne. Reszta aromatów takich jak obora, fenole, trawa jest zdominowane wyżej wymienionymi owocami i biszkoptem. 

USTA : piwo jest średnio nasycone i puszyste. 
Ogólnie piwo jest średnio słodkie i winne jak słodsze pół-wytrawne białe wino. Gorzkość jest delikatniejsza niż delikatne uczucie kwaśności w posmaku. Piwo również zostawia ciapkę w ustach o smaku wysuszonego siana i drożdży. 

ODCZUCIA : smaczne piwo, bardzo przystępne piwo między blondem a saison. Bretty jeszcze nie wykonały niestety swojej roboty ale fajnie się wżeniły w całość. Ogólnie mówiąc piwo jest bez wady ale jak pomyślę, że za cenę tej butelczyny mam trzy rasowe Saisony to prawdopodobnie do tego piwa więcej nie wrócę.

Pours a slightly hazy straw gold with a fairly tall eggshell cap that settles slowly and leaves some nice-looking ropes of foamy lace. Nose involves soft fruit notes of peach and white grape, a subtle funkiness, hearty bread dough, light spice, perhaps a light nuttiness. Lightly sweet, somewhat bitter, a touch tart. Light to medium bodied, creamy, fairly oily, decent action, finishing on the dry side with a lingering fruity toastiness. Not the most dynamic or refreshing saison, but it is delicate and enjoyable.

Purchased at Bottles and Cans in Chicago, IL; enjoyed at home on my birthday while watching Cubs vs. Sox. I can’t believe I’ve never had this one as it’s been out for forever. Appearance is champagne like, light and dry, bubbly, with a rich head that bubbles away relatively quickly. Aroma of clove, dry yeast, light pepper, light banana, light and good. Taste is more wine like than it is brew like, and I like that. Definitely finishes dry, peppery, feels like there is a lot going on and it melds together very nicely. Great stuff!
Draught. This is a nice tart brew for summer drinking on the porch or with a fish dish.

12oz bottle. Clear golden color with a light white head. Orange yeast wine aroma. Medium heavy body. A bit of a wine texture with carbonation. Wine citrus orange spice flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours lightly-hazed lemon straw into the glass, with a large soapy head that leaves soapy lacing. This one has been aging for 2 years (bottle-conditioned to age up to 5 years), and boy has it mellowed nicely! Flavors are full of yeasty esters and light barnyard grains. Flavors of light lemon, melon, curt grains, wheat and light spices meld together deliciously. The smooth, easy quaff has just enough lively carbonation to provide activity. Perfect summer brew here, and another great Goose Island offering. A nice, non-high gravity ageable complex summer offering?? Who’da thunk it? Awesome!

From a bottle at Delano's in Vegas. Pours a hazy gold and makes a thin white head and a bit of lacing. Aroma is of clove and coriander and a bit of citrus. Mouthfeel is light and effervescent. Tastes of spice and citrus and a bit of sour and wheat. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clove, banana, straw, a little bit of spice but not too much, with an orange zest finish. Pretty good.

Clear light orange-yellow pour., Medium to tall white head that sticks around fairly well. Grainy aroma, some spice, coriander, yeasty whiffs as well. Taste follows with heavier earthy notes. Overall fairly complex, although still not my favorite.

2014 (sur le goulot). Jaune pâle, voilée, avec un col de mousse abondant, mais qui s’amincit rapidement. Nez de blé, d’orange, d’agrumes, de levure et de paille. Goût de levure, fruité, de zeste d’orange, d’épices et de grains.

765 mL bottle (how odd), marked 2013 vintage on top.  Pours a hazed pale golden with a bubbly white head.  Tart orange, lemon, and lime citrus aroma.  Tart lemon-lime citrus, orange again, a bit of saltine.  It’s pretty tasty, though not really what I expected.
Aroma is straw, cloves, citrus. Taste is straw, banana esters, cloves and pepper, vanilla, and light clementine with seltzer water.
Aroma is one of beer’s most complex features. Aroma is propelled by lively CO2 and dampened by pillowy heads - especially nitrogen foam. Click on a term below to add it to your tasting notes.
Gelb, orange. In der Nase würzig, Heu, Hefe. Am Gaumen Süße, Hefe, banane, belgische Noten, würzig, leicht herb, rund und süffig.

765ml bottle 2014 vintage pours semi clear light orange with 2 finger head. Nose is soft grainy spice, vanilla citrus and bits of belgian yeast. Taste has a surprisingly creamy mouthfeel, feels undercarbed on the palate even tho the head was plentiful, soft rounded grain spice, bitter orange, dry light vanilla and cereal. Finishes with some earthy wheat, light pepper, grain, and light vanilla citrus spice. I feel like something was not quite there with this bottle, mouthfeel was somewhat lifeless and it hadn’t really dried out enough to be great.

Bottle at Leuven Innovation Beerfestival, thanks for sharing! Right up after Matilda, another Belgian copy which does a bad job. Yeast, low bitter, I even rather drink Palm than this, it has the same metallic, yeasty, taste. Bad.

Hazy, yellow color. Big , white head. Aroma of yeast, fruits , spices , lemon and hint of farmyard. Crispy , fruity taste full of spices . Champagne feeling in the mouth . Dry finish with moderate , hoppy bitterness.

bottle sample at LIBF, poured an poured an amber looking colour with a white head. nose of fresh citrus, crisp malts, tropical fruits, mango, stone fruits, lemon zest, oak, pineapple juice, spicy yeast, grape skin, vanilla sweetness, earth notes, leading to an dry aftertaste.

Thanks for sharing! Sampled 650 ml. bottle @ Leuven Innovation Beer Festival. 2012 Version I believe. Dark amber, little white head. Nose is oily, dull & bland, yeasty, light hay & dull oak,… Very boring, oily, bland yeasty, sugary taste, thin, caramel, metallic, light oak,… Dull & oily,… Tastes like a boring Spéciale belge, disappointing for me.

Bottle sample @ Leuven Beer Innovation 2015, shared with the RB Belgian crew.
Dorée claire, col fin blanc.
Arôme au bouquet qui met bien en avant ce léger côté poivre concassé, le tout ponctué par un agréable fleuri houblonné noble avec un profil levure assez belge.
Palais est fruité sur une écorce d’orange, le tout avec un petit renforcement poivrée très plaisant et qui réveille un peu les papilles. Reste belge dans son inspiration levure le tout accompagné et contrebalancé par un agréable fini boisé de chêne et de raisin blanc.

Murky yellow brew with a white head. Carbonation is extremely lively. Aromas of fresh citrus. Tastes of lemon peel, some lime notes, biscuit, and fresh wheat. Bittersweet, semi-tart finish. Barnyard funk. Not much to this, I was expecting more. Decent.

Medium snowwhite head over pale golden, clear beer. Smoked nose, tarry and phenolic, strange - then sour fruit and some citrus. Taste is not smoked at all, but contains some phenols. Sweet fruitjuice, that take a long time lingering on. Medium bodied at best. Not bad.

Goose Island ’farmhouse ale’ aged on wine barrels, tasted at LIBF ’15.  Medium thick but strongly cobweb-lacing, off-white head and hazy golden blonde robe. Fruity and quite complex aroma of pear, mango, straw, lemon zest, peach, pepper, pineapple, hint of wood, grape peel but alas, a faint touch of H2S (rotting egg!) as well, fortunately receding quickly. Fruity, estery, ’Belgian’ taste, subdued sweetness, orange, pineapple, mango, berries, light acidity (lemon peel), nice and soft bready malt sweetness below but still somewhat thinnish body, drying finish with a dash of spicy hops, peppery yeast accents and woody tannins, with persisting grape fruitiness. Quite complex and tasty, too bad for the H2S; tasted again in Amsterdam this year and it did not have this problem anymore, so my rating here is an average of both.
Trübes goldenes Bier mit einer geringen weißen schaumkrone. Geruch leicht säuerlich, Steinobst, süß. Geschmack süß malzig, bananig, Gewürze, hefig, lecker.
Had this at a tasting at my Wegmans. A nice Belgian style ale. Great yeasty aroma and a nice complex flavors. I’ll have to pick up a bottle soon.
Really good saison. spice and citrus on the front, slightly tart on the backend
On tap during Madison Craft Beer week. Light body. Sweet spicy aroma with a subtle funk. Taste is slight pepper, some orange, kind of funky, with hints of citrus. Good amount of Belgian funk.
Pours golden with a big creamy white head. Aroma of wine, orange and hops. Tastes of oranges, citrus, malt and wine. Dry finish. Very drinkable.

Straw with sediment. Nose is a bit sour apple, lemon, funky, a bit of bread. Taste starts off tart citrusy, a bit sour, then comes a lot of barnyard funk, earthy. The aftertaste isn't great, really a lot of funk here.

Drank from a pint glass, poured from a twelve ounce bottle at the Penalty Box! Aromas of oranges, and slight hops. Pours a hazy, lemonade/orangy color, with white fluffy head. Tastes of grapes, slighly oranges, and champagne. A good complex brew.

Bottle. Hazy golden beer with a large white head. Aroma is spicy with notes of citrus, wheat, yeast, herbs, grass and apricots. Flavor is spicy with notes of citrus, wheat, yeast, herbs, apricot and oranges. Well balanced.
Sweet to the palate pours pale yellow with a mild creamy head. So far this is my favorite farmhouse ale/saison
Hazy straw yellow with fizzy white head. Aroma is Brett, bread year, citrus and spice. Dry beer with a little tart and yeasty flavor. Very nice
Bottle. Pours a cloudy golden color with white head. Citrus, sweet bread, yeasty, spicy, lemon zest aromas. Lemon, spicy, yeasty, fresh citrus, bread flavors. Pretty nice.

765 ml into many a chalice. Pours an opaque golden straw with fluffy white head (quickly dissipating). Nose of apple, orange, a bit of peppery; slightly off-putting tart flavour. Like apple juice. Slick and kind of light on the palate. Ok.

Light cloudy lemon body with fizzy white head and a bit of lacing. Bubblegum and sweet yeasty aroma. Blast of tartness that fades. Taste is semi sweet yeasty with a touch of tartness and a dry finish. Not bad.

(Bottle) Clear, bubbly yellow body. Wispy white head. Aroma of orange peel, vanilla, black pepper, yeast. Medium body. Flavor is bright and tart; orange peel is especially evident on the back end; peppery and yeasty.

ENG: 765ml bottle from Liquor Mart in Winnipeg, poured into the Teku. Strongly opalescent, yellow / straw / eggy color with huuuge, white glairy head. Aromas of tropical fruits, citrusy, very subtle bananas and cloves. Taste is very dissapointing, it’s like cheap sparkling wine mixed with lemon+banana juice with added water. Some sour aftertaste. Rather dry, low body, very high carbonation. Overall it is very drinkable, fruity, but I think too watery with very low flavor levels.



PL: Butelka 765ml zakupiona w Liquor Mart w Winnipeg, przelana do Teku. Mocno opalizująca, żółto-jajeczna barwa, z ogromną, jasną, białkową pianą (duże bąbelki). Aromaty owoców tropikalnych, cytrusów, delikatne banany i goździki. W smaku rozczarowanie - przypomina tanie wina musujące, do tego rozwodnione, zmieszane z sokiem cytrynowo-bananowym. Bardzo wodniste. W posmaku dość kwaśne. Raczej wytrawne, niskie odczucie w ustach, bardzo wysokie nasycenie. Podsumowując bardzo pijalne piwo, owocowe, ale jednak wydaje mi się, że jest zbyt wodniste, z niskim poziomem smakowym.

Sweet and sweet fragrance. Much citrus and a little yeast with a light fruity taste. Like this strong. Good bitterness which fills the upper part of the mouth a weak moment. I liked this beer a lot. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

A big 750mL bottle for my 9-double-dougnut rating... haven’t had one of these in a while, but seeing as GIBC was one of the very first craft beers I has when I moved to Chicago 21 years ago, this seemed a worthy beer to rate for the occasion. Pours a pale straw yellow, big white frothy head with decent retention and lacing. Nose is grassy, some mild funk, hints of white vinegar, chardonnay grapes, green apple. Mouth is light-medium bodied, lightly tart, creamy palate, bread dough, fresh cut hay, lemon grass, white pepper. Finishes with a subtle sweetness. Essentially almost everything about this one is subtle, which with all the extremism in the style you see from craft brewers lately, isn’t necessarily a bad thing. 900 bottles of beer on the wall, 900 bottles of beer... take ’em all down, buy me a new liver... 900 bottles of beer on the wall. ;-P
Bottle pours gold, white head. Citrus, cloves, pepper, wheat, banana. Moderately bitter. A little sweet. Dry, crisp body.

Pours cloudy straw yellow with small white head.
Aroma of yeast, peaches, lemon and grass with a bit of funk. On the palate, the citrus note shifts to orange, and the funk is very polite, even bringing flowers. The advertised vanilla is just a hint, and the white pepper is also restrained.
It’s a nice medium body, with some effervescence, but "champagne" is a reach. An American take on a saison, this is a farmhouse surrounded by suburban tracts after the farm has been sold. But for the US, it’s a very good beer.

Goose Island Sofie has a medium, white head, a yellow-gold, quite bubbly appearance, with powdery sediment and minimal lacing. The aroma is of brettanomyces yeast, lemon, light wheat and barley, and sweetness. Taste is of the same elements, with noticeable, yet mild, bitterness. Mouthfeel is light to medium, and Goose Island Sofie finishes champagne-like and drinkable. RJT

765ml bottle, Sept 3, 2014 bottle date. Hazy yellowy-straw body with a thick foamy white head over-top with some visible effervescence and sediment as well. yeast presents itself on the the nose, that funky barnyard type. some tart green apple skin, wheat, coriander, pear, white pepper, white flowers, some other flower-based aromas I can’t quite pick out are present. quite carbonated . Not getting too much vanilla on the finish, more of a super subtle butterscotch/ green grape finish with medium bitterness. Body is a little thin, quite sessionable.

Light citrine color, cloudy, tall and persistent very white head. Fizzy, careful opening the bottle. 
Pretty nose, floral but also amoniacal. 
Light body, moderate flavor, palate cleaning mouthfeel, catches you by surprize if you are not familiar with the style. 
Sour, dry, hardly any bitterness. 
Yeasty, citrusy only in the acidity. 
Not bad, if you care for the style. Probably occasionally a good starter for the night (about 4 oz), at best, but not my style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

La carbonatation est bonne pour le style, et il y a une belle présence d’agrumes et un peu d’épices. Mais, c’est un peu léger pour être une grande saison. Bonne, mais un peu faible. La finition est sec mais quand même il n’y a pas trop de fruit ni épices dans le goût.
Bottle from a friend (2011 bottle). Fruity and yeasty smell with some green apples. Similar taste. Fresh, a bit spritsy but also rounded of.

Pours a hazy, effervescent yellow with a foamy, long-lasting white head. Aroma is citrus and spice. Flavor is tart citrus and spice, with some creamy vanilla in the finish. Has a medium body feel. Very tasty.

Apparence: D?une couleur jaune paille partiellement opaque, elle est coiffée d?une bonne mousse d?une bonne durée. Excellente effervescence avec des bulles de taille moyenne. 

Arômes: Au nez, ce sont des arômes de malt frais avec des notes d’agrumes ( orange)

Saveurs: En bouche, c’est un corps moyen. Au goût, c’est un goût de malt frais avec des notes d’agrumes (orange). Finale moyenne, avec beaucoup d’effervescence qui rappelle le champagne. Aucune amertume. 


Fiche technique
Style: Saison
Format: 765 ml
Taux d?alcool : 6,5%
Foggy blonde with a white head. Nice, sweet, Belgian aroma. Sweet, yeasty, lightly hopped. Medium to slightly light body. Not terribly unique but drinkable. Thanks to PorterPounder.

Pours a hazy straw holding decent effervescence and showing good retention and lacing properties. The nose is mostly yeasty (but also grainy) with orange peel, nice floral and earthy elements. The taste bold and fresh with the yeast at the frontline giving nice acidity to the brew. Citrusy, floral, a touch resinous with a light grassy finish. Very nice beer to enjoy with light dishes like salads or fish. Cheers!

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a tulip glass.
Aroma- Has a great "beer" aroma of yeast and spice
Appearance- This is a light golden color with some haziness visible. Pours a thick white head;
Taste- Incredible, citrus yeast and spice, a fantastic experience
Palate- A light to medium bodied beer with moderate carbonation, A dry finish 
Overall- One of the best beers I have ever had
Nice refreshing beer, a very subdued sour. Kind of lacking anything that makes you go wow, slightly thin mouthfeel.
Pours a very light golden color. Has a nice but subtle aroma. Taste flowery but is refreshing.
Bouteille de 765ml. Arôme très agrume. Belle couleur orangée vive et rafraîchissante. En bouche, c’est très acide. Manque d’amertume pour balancer le côté Brett.

Bottled. Pour into a tulip, hazy yellow golden color with a white fluffy head. Aroma is orange, citrus, lemon, banana, wheat, coriander. Flavor is lemon, citrus, orange, sour and funk. Actually really nice. But it is the most sour I’d enjoy.

pours a murky straw gold with a medium bubbly white head. Aroma is complex. some hay/grass, some spice like coriander, hint of citrus. The taste is refreshing. Slight citrus, but also some warming spice fades in. Quick dry finish with some pleasant alcohol warming on the end. Really a good beer!

Sofie, Sofie, such a good tasty beer named Sofie. Slightly hoppy farm ale, light in color and refreshing in taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours with a foamy head, need to wait a while to pour all. Beautiful color, hazy golden with a lot of head. Smells of citrus, coriander, tastes tart, fresh, like spring. 

Great beer for a hot day.
Glass. Definitely sparkling with tart citrus grapefruit flavor. Dry, but refreshing. Maybe a little tiring to drink but unique.
Pours golden with a white head. Very light body. Belgian beer flavor with citrus fruits. Has a slight spiciness and sweet wine after taste.
his is a solid farmhouse. Higher ABV than expected in this style. Slightly less carbonated as well. But recommended.
Pours hazy yellow with a large white head. Aroma is sour citrus and barnyard. Very zesty in the mouth with a tart, biting, sour finish.

Pours a hazy yellow colour with a wispy head to the bottom, but no lacing. The taste is full of pale malts and sour citrus Starts with a flash of soft pale malt flavours followed by tart lemon flavours, wheat and low key spiciness. Could almost be a champagne of beers. Very dry. Like it.

Pours a golden color with a white head. Yeast, fruit, spice, wheat and funk aroma. Yeast, pear, apple, orange, peach, clove, spice, wheat and funk flavors. Medium light body and average carbonation. Fruit, yeast and spice finish.

Pours a pale golden body with a thin head. Funky and a little citric aroma. Very nice taste with tones of hay.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

this one was different...poured from bomber 2012 vintage (06/20/12)...pour was a cloudy golden hue...nose had a sour banana and yeast thing going on...mouth was actually enjoyable..Belgian yeast spice and fruit...maybe green apples or pears...different but good...glad i tried.

Buying this beer was a bit like a community service. Two 4-packs of this and 2 of Matilda have been sitting on my supermarket warm shelf for over a year. I didn’t think age would hurt it much (it hasn’t) but I didn’t think sitting on the supermarket shelf was good for it much either. But at $12.99 a 4-pack, the usual store shoppers were scrolling past with ferocity. Understandable. But as I stood there in a ticking mood, realizing this was 1 of 3 beers in the whole store I hadn’t tried, and the other 2 were surely light struck over-priced Innis & Gunn 4-packs, I said fuck it. Well I can’t quite get a handle on this beer. It variously tastes like a an interesting peppery doughy lightly bretted saison, and then a banana-clove phenolic tripel. It’s no secret which of those 2 I like and which I hate. It’s like a different beer sneaks into my glass every 10 minutes. But at least the lingering smell in the glass is the doughy grassy hop bretty side. Hazy golden yellow, thick meringue of a head.

A: hazy amber yellow with a tight small champagne-esque head that dissipates fairly quickly 

S: again champagne and not much else that smells like a beer. slightly sour aroma

T: immediately dry and winy at the same time. now i get a bit of bread from the malt but the wine barrel still dominates flavor. not bad but different. little to no hop taste detected

M: medium body. lovely fine carbonation. again much like champagne. winy finish is actually nice

O: overall a good beer if you can concentrate on the fact that this is a beer and not wine. nice for some occasions i guess but i prefer to stick to something that doesn’t take me so long to drink. nice offering although quite expensive from GI.
12 oz. bottle dated 2012, a gusher. Cloudy, pale gold pour. Aroma of wild yeast, pears, citrus. Very tart and refreshing, smooth and easy to drink. Recommended.

750 mL. bottled 07 Oct 2014. Active body is golden with a lasting film of bubbles. Aroma of spicy pollen, honey and light fruits - white grape, apple, peach and mild orange zest. A touch of bubblegum and wheat as well. Flavors of white grape, honey, lightly tart apple, pear, aromatic flowers and spicy vanilla. Gum and wheat flour on the finish. Light-medium body is too fizzy for my tastes, but very drinkable nonetheless.
Very carbonated and tart with a thin body. Can’t taste much of the wine barrel or orange peel. Interesting beer but a bit disappointed in it.

2009 Bottle. A pale blonde saison with a thin white head. In aroma, a nice sweet fruity malt with light peaches, light oxidation, OK. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity malt with light candy sugar, pear pulp, light coriander, curacao, very nice and smooth.

65 cl bottle, Calgary, AB, Canada via Coop. Hazy bright yellow, yeast and faint cardamom aroma with lots of citrus hops. Very bright hop flavour, lemon and pepper come through, with lots of carbonation and some bready vanilla. Really nice.

12 oz bottle poured into chalice. Pours a hazy light yellow gold with rapid dissipating white head. Aroma of yeast and citrus. Very smooth with a mild carbonation. Starts very yeasty and then gets slightly tart. Finished quite smooth.

Gold, bright, 2-inches of egg-shell white head that fade moderate-to-quick. Aroma of straw, dried grass, light apricot and lemon grass, considerable blueberry and some raspberry. Bit of dry biscuit. Body is medium, watery-creamy fell, Soft carbonation, little burn. Flavor is a bit tart with sweet hay mixed in there. (Reminds me of a saison I brewed in which I added lactic acid on top of a semi-sweet malt background. This was not a pleasant combination, but featured more intense tartness/sweetness). A bit of blue/raspberry, hint of strawberry, floral, corn flakes, An OK saison (especially compared with my expectations). The body is a bit too flat/watery, needs to be lighter/crisper, and I’m not a fan of the raw lactic touch without the cheesy notes associated with Brett.  Could be a bad bottle; I do recall being very impressed with this previously.
You know what? That is an excellent and refreshing Saison. Come to think of it, that’s pretty much the definition of Saison so, WAY TO GO

This is definitely one of the best saisons I’ve ever had. I sampled this at the "pub" inside the O’Hare airport. This beer was funky, fruity and delicious! The body was lively and well-carbonated. I tasted some spicy notes from the hops and maybe some pepper, along with some grapefruit, orange and yeast.

Big brown wine bottle, 2013 edition. Pours a very light golden colour, slightly hazy with a big white cap, good retention because of heavy carbonation and some foamy lace. Sour aromas with orange juice notes. The taste has no sourness, but the oranges are still present. Hints of Belgian Ale yeast. Wet mouthfeel with a little stickiness, making this one very refreshing, fruity and almost sessionable. Becomes hazier near the end with lots of particles. This releases spices in the nose. Pretty nice overall and for fans of mimosa, but in a beer.

Tap at haute dish. Gold with white head and good lacing. Beautiful nose of crisp citrus and floral alcohol. Citrus peel, sweet, some pearlike taste. Very clean and crisp and easy to drink. Great beer that drinks much lighter than it is.

Tap at The Oak. Clear gold pour with a small bubbly head. Aromas are pears, citrus, light sour red fruit, light Belgian yeast, and black pepper. Tastes slightly fruity with a big yeast finish. Pears, orange peel, black pepper, very light sourness, light barnyard, and a hint of red wine in the finish. Very dry finish. Interesting saison.
Light fruity and slightly sour smell, taste is smooth and much the same, very slight citrus finish, degrades a touch with age x2
Pours clear blond with high creamy white head, diminishing. Some lacing. Aroma is of wine, oranges, citrus. Taste is of oranges, citrus, malt, wine, sligth acidity. Dry finish.
Bottle to snifter. Funky yeast and crushed wheat malt. Moderate low orange. Clear, pale gold with minimal which head that leaves a collar. Taste is orange and sour tartness. Spritzy carbonation.

2014 BOD 8/7/14. Pours a clear light amber (golden, champagne). Massive head volume, world class lacing and retention. Light, but complex, nose of Belgian like yeast, sweet light fruit (pear, grape, apple) and just a hint of spice. Light medium body with a nice smooth texture made a bit prickly from the above normal carbonation level. .Effervescence is evident throughout. The flavor profile is quite nice. Extremely complex, very well balanced but not overly intense, it allows all flavors of the nose to emerge. It begins with the fruit, then develops a white wine like note in the middle coupled with a bit of dryness. The finish is where the farmhouse character emerges with an ever so slight peppery funk that fades into a mild tart dryness. Outstanding and an excellent entry choice for the Saison style.
Bottle from Fujioka's. A bit of sourness up front followed by a subtle bitterness. Nose is somewhat peppery with citrus notes. Pretty good overall.
Really good, has a sweet after taste with a bit of a bitter bite. The orange peel must give the bitter taste. Yum!
Nice spicy peppery aroma with a golden medium bodied hazy beer. Taste is bitter and slightly sour, really refreshing. Some extra citrus in the aroma. Not too complex, but very well made great beer.
on tap dorata velata lieve funky un tocco speziato scorza agrume ma abbastanza dolce una nota di vaniglia
(Tap) nice farmhouse aroma. But, super astringent and lots of "farm" taste. I don’t like this one.

Slightly hazy golden yellow pour with large white head. Aroma of lemon citrus, orange peel, yeast and pepper. Taste of lemon zest, orange peel, peppery spice, yeast, slight hops. Light bodied, higher carbonation and peppery dry finish.

2013 bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with lively carbonation and a foamy white head. Aroma is spicy with some vanilla and orange peel. A bit citrusy with some spices and a bit of vanilla in the finish. Somewhat tart. Light bodied with a dry, tart finish. Somewhat nuanced. I enjoyed it.

Poivré légèrement,pommes vertes,raisin verts,bergamote, belle acidité.C’est rafraichissent pas à peut près!,un petit coté surette(20% vieillit en fut de vin blanc),c’est très pétillant,dans les tanins quelques traces de pamplemousse blanc,mais très ’été’ comme bière. très bonne

de couleur dore legerement voile on sens tout l agrume comme l orange c est cote vin blanc en bouche c est une trres rafraichissante c erst estival le o range qui est un accord parfait avec se type de biere
Bottle - Lemon, pepper and lots of funk. Clear gold with a rich white head. Lemon, light peach, funk, hay and citrus. Light and bubbly. Nice.

9 month old bottle from Brooks Place Tavern. Pale orange and hazy appearance with a lacy white head. Aroma of tart fruits, yeast, herbs, floral notes, citrus zest, light peppery spice and light white wine notes. Similar flavor, crisp and smooth with a medium body. Nicely done American saison.

765 ml bottle into wine glass. Belgium style saison, my favourite style. Love this beer. Funk, yeasty, citrus, micro-carbonation, dry finish. Pours straw yellow with big, fluffy white head. Complex taste, tart and bitter and mild spice to start, but mildy sweet finish. Love the balanced funk (Bret). Buy lots and start a vertical.

Pours a clear yellow color with a pretty big white head and lots of carbonation. Nose is lemon, some apple, white wine, sour candy, banana, kind of funky. Sour taste you can definitely feel the citrus lingering in the mouthfeel. Medium body. Pretty good.

765ml? bottle. Light golden pour with a white head that dissipates fairly quickly leaving a bit of lace. Fairly funky nose with some apple notes and a certain white wine quality. On the palate there’s an interesting slice note with a more notable wine character. The funk is a little less pronounced and the finish lasts quite a while.

Bottle picked up from Ralphs in Studio City, CA. I am enjoying my last beer for a few months as I start winter triathlon training, so I am very happy I picked this guy up today. 
Pours a murky golden hue with a medium white head that is mostly diminishing. Lively carbonation as well.
Aroma is yeasty with lots of hints of barn yard. I smell some banana and ginger in there as well. Smells like its going to be one refreshing brew!
Aroma is yeasty, with a slight tart beginning that fades to spicy middle and end. 
Light mouthfeel with lively carbonation

Best Saison I have had to date. Big, bold and wonderful notes fo apple, white grapes, lemon, yeast, wheat, floral hops and clean basement. Light and hazy piss yellow with a sexy white topper following the action downward. Tart, lightly funked, bitter up front and sweet but not cloying on the back end. A curious spiciness lingers inviting more suckling upon this mid carbonated and very lightly oily temptress.

Poured a light hazy straw with massive frothy white head. Aroma is giant musty old basement, vinegar, citrus and herbs. Tastes of herbs, candy, orange peel, lemon, and a bit vinous. Has a medium chewy body with low carbonation and a little tart that leaves a refreshing bitterness near the end. Very good lacing and very easy to drink. A real pleasure.

Smells of raspberry, yeast, citrusy and grassy. Pours as a clear gold liquid with a thick white head. 

Tastes bright, bitter, straw like, pear. Lacks the funk that is usually associated with this style. Light body, high carbonation dry finish.

A well executed ale, likely has more in common with champagne than beer, but is very enjoyable. Although it is well executed, it is lacking the funk and fringe flavour that I love with this style.

"a nice little saison, though it’ll be hard to go back to, given the premium price. a little too funky outta the bottle, but the aroma got better once it was poured. still some barnyard, but not overpowering. just a touch of the orange peel in the aroma and flavor. more earthy/grassy and peppery. would make a very nice summer brew in six-pack form, but not for $8-9 per bottle."

12 oz bottle. Pours a hazy yellow with an ample, frothy white head. Aroma of citrus, bananas, and sugary candy. Tastes of unripe bananas, pear, oranges, lemons, and white cracker. Is tart and then spicy, peppery. A carbonated crisp, dry palate.
Pours very pale yellow with a white head. Aroma of citrus (orange) and subtle pepper. Subtle flavor of orange.
Pours a cloudy yellow with a bright white head with much lacing. Nose is citrus, clean. Palate is medium body Taste is the crisp freshness of a Saison. 2014 vintage @ 6.5% ABV in a Champagne bottle.
Bottle. Cloudy white orange. Great white cap. Aroma is funky and citrusy. Spicy. Taste is sweet and tart. Crisp, with a dry finish.

765 ml bottle. Pours a hazy yellow with an average, frothy, white head that laces. Yeasty aroma with citrus and spice. Sweet flavour of citrus, yeast and a mildly tart note with a dry, spicy vanilla finish. Medium body with an oily texture and soft carbonation.
Just a fabulous saison. Not much else to say - subtle citrus and spice, nicely balanced, very tasty.
Pours a hazy gold with a thin head, highly carbonated. Spicy orange peel and pepper yeast aroma. Classic spicy farmhouse yeast taste with orange peel. Slight grit and mostly clean mouthfeel.

Cloudy dark yellow. Light white head. Aroma is a little sour, vanilla, and mild funkiness. Flavour is smooth, wheat, slighty chalky, a little sour with hints of wildflower. Tasty and smooth. Elegant for style compared to many.

I typically shy away from American saisons as I believe it’s one style we haven’t nailed down yet. This beer proves me wrong. Delicious beer. Aroma was spicy with light malt, orange peel and grass. Pour was a nice cloudy light gold with a two finger white head. Taste was light and delicious. Melon, orange and notes of grass with a slight graininess. Very refreshing. Mild carbonation which was disappointing compared to others in the style

Bomber into a tulip glass. pours a light straw yellow, with a huge white head that lingers, leaving good lacing. Nose is tart citrus. Taste is tart, dry citrus with a hint of pepper and spice. Very refreshing. Medium length finish, with high carbonation. In the style of Belgian saisons, and this is a good one.

oooo smells oh so good! Sourish somewhat musty apple, buttery orange, like pepper, pear, grass, flavoids of this: pear, orange peel, white pepper, not convinced about he clove but i’ll mention it, lame-o white wine, tasty tasty. very enjoyable.

Can this be better than the Watemellon Boxer we just started the night with........ only time will tell. Piss gold body with just a thin film floating on top. Lemon grass, zesty, hay.................... sweetness, honey. Taste and aroma are close to the same. This is so drinkable, so very drinkable. Lemon, tangerine, grass, and an acitic finish. Hit gingerale, yes ginger. Yes this beer is better then Watermellon Boxer.

Sample at the Wrigleyfield Goose Island. It is a very pale straw gold with a foamy eggshell white head. The aroma is of white pepper and citrus with funky saison notes that are reminiscent of sweat socks but still somehow remains very light and appetizing. A light zesty body compliments the peppery, green, citrusy saison flavor well. Really nice for summer.

765ml brown bottle. Bottled 25 Jun 14. Pale lemony yellow pour with some haze. White cap that fades into a thin swirl, minimal lacing. Interesting nose, some fruity apple notes, spice/pepper, citrus. Taste has some fruity notes, grass, spice, citrus, trace of sourness sneaking in. Orange peel lingers a bit as well as that fruitiness from before and a good hit of yeast. Good carbonation. Enjoyable, a bit sweeter than expected.

Orange yellow pour, with nice frothy white head. Aroma of citrus, orange peel, coriander, some dry grass. Extremely well balanced, touch of sweetness on the tip of the tongue. Complex on the palate and the finish. Citrus, spice, and herbaceous.

Dorée, dans le genre champs de blé. Mousse éphémère. Nez citron, bergamote et tangerine, de blé et de poivre sishuan. Le houblon est bien présent. Aussi légèrement surette. Thé et verveine se mettent de la partie. Bouche franche et sûre ... codalies pas trop élevé ... même un peu mince. Légèrement aqueuse. Pas mal pour le style.

Transfer from BA review on 12-17-12-
 Poured from bottle into tulip glass

 Appearance –Pours a quite hazy orange-yellow color with a one finger white head. The head relatively quickly fades to a persistent film in the process leaving a nice level of lacing on the sides of the glass.

Smell- The smell is heavy of yeast and banana as well as a strong biscuit aroma. Mixed with these smells are some lighter notes of an orange and some coriander and light pepper spice. 

 Taste – The taste begins with some bready flavors mixed with an orange citrus taste. A yeasty taste with a light banana flavor ten comes to the tongue. The brew is smooth and malty up front, but as the taste moves on the beer sours up. Flavors of a lemon citrus enter the tongue more toward the middle of the taste.. Some flavors of coriander and a herbal/grassy funk flavor meld with the sour flavors more toward the end. At the finish of the taste a quite sour citrus flavor of orange and lemon mixed with a light bitter nature of a funky grassy/herbal hop taste and some spices linger on the tongue leaving a rather satisfying sour funked taste to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel – The body of the beer was on the average side in terms of its thickness and creaminess with a carbonation level that is just slightly above average. The slightly higher carbonation is quite nice for the sour, funky, and citrus flavors of the brew. This coupled with the medium body make in very drinkable and quite appropriate for the style and flavors. 

 Overall – This was a nice easy drinking Belgian saison with a nice blend of sour/bitter/funk/malt One to try if you get a chance.
750 ml bottle. Pours a light gold with full head that settles quickly. Aromas of lemons, beeswax, and melons. Flavors of lemon meringue, tropical fruit, and brett. Smooth and creamy.
12 oz bottle pours a dark golden color with a nice white head. Aromas of, light citrus, spice, yeast. Light bodied with a dry tart finish

Pours a large and quicke dissipating white frothy head atop a clear straw coloured body. Nose of lemon and rotten cantiloupe. Flavour is very light and a tad too thin mid-palate. The finish is mildly barnyard and spruce. Okay. Purchased at Spinnakers Spirit Merchant (James Bay) for around $9.

Aroma is citrus, grapefruit and grapefruit. Some wild saison yeast aswell. Taste is sour at the beginning with hints of citrus, grapefruit and wild yeast. Appearance is a slightly hazy straw /gold with a pearl bubbly head that retains fairly well.

Pours a hazy golden colour with a slightly foamy white head. Very citrusy aromas (mostly grapefruit) along with wheat. Strong grapefruit flavour along with notes of wheat. Good carbonation and a slightly dry and bitter finish from the grapefruit.

Bona cervesa, és bastant equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, es bastante equilibrada y sabrosa.
bottle, thanks to skykob for bringing this back from the states. very pale with a light haze; aroma of apple skin and cream cheese; some pleasant yeast bite, light zesty citrus; very drinkable

750ml bottle pours a clear golden color with a 2 finger white head that retains well and leaves some spotted lacing on the glass. Tiny beads of carbonation rise to surface. Aroma is light fruits, particularly orange zest with some yeasty notes and grains. Taste is a light fruity and malty sweetness with a hint of lemon tartness and orange zest bitter finishing with some dry yeast. Light to medium bodied with some generous carbonation. A decent brew for the style, but nothing special.

Nicely citrusy nose with a lot of grapefruit. Taste is a touch of lemon, with grapefruit and a bit of kandi sugar finish. Quite nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a hazy gold. Has a strong citrus, wheat and yeast aroma. A very strong citrus and grapefruit taste with wheat, yeast and light spices. Very dry aftertaste from the yeast and wheat.
Pours cloudy yellow with low white head. Aroma of citrus, wheat, yeast, light honey, light pepper. Taste is wheat and honey sweet with peppery finish. Light and smooth body.

Leve sabor azedo com leve aroma cítrico . Amargo no ponto pra mim. Tomar bem gelada

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at Pony Bar, New York September 2013. Light amber colour with a sticky white head. Tropical fruit aroma that carries over into the flavour.

Bottled. Hazy yellow pour with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, hay, pear, and grape. Fruity and sweet, with biscuit malt and a thick body that keeps it a bit too heavy, especially for 6.5%. Still, enjoyable beer.

The body is light and hazy with a bright straw yellow color when held up to the light. The head on top is tall fluffy. It quickly settles down to a tighter half inch cap of foam that hangs on well and makes some spotty lacing. In the nose I pick up notes of funky yeast, sweet fruity candy and faint citrus with some light spicy phenol as well. The aroma here is lovely and just pulled me in. On the tongue the sweet fruity candy like notes meet the dry funk of the yeast as well as the mild phenol spice and pale wheat like malt. The balance here is just on the dry side and in the finish it adds just a touch of tart citrus and hop bitterness which yields one heck of a refreshing and modestly complex brew.
Bottle from Hazel's. Golden color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, earthy notes, hops, coriander, spices, grass and mango. Bitter finish with hops, citrus, spices and mango. Exquisite saison.

On tap at Appalachinan Vinter. Pretty decent for a saison. Belgian, but in a very likeable subtle way.  Definitely reminiscent of champagne. Pours hazy gold- lots of carbonation. Nice yeasty notes.  Pepper, citrus and spice come through in spades. Light on the palate and refreshing. Finishes really crisp.   Great for the style.
Loved this saison! Very light colored and gives off fresh aromas of fruit, spices and citrus. Excellent beer.

On tap at Cannery Row Brewing Company in Monterey, CA. Hazy yellow pour. Nice aroma with some vinous character and a little barnyard funk. Flavor is light with some orange notes. Level of carbonation is hight. Easy to drink.
Decent Belgian ale, a bit malty and not yeasty enough, or light bodied enough for a saison. Still a good quaff, and nice to know the USA is getting better at the style.

Pours a clear yellow sparkling liquid with a thin white head. Sour fresh apple, cider and Belgian yeast aromas. Almost like champagne. Smooth in the mouth with a light but long bitterness and some funk. Very fruity with green apples and orange notes. Low carbonation.

Bière jaune pâle, bien voilée, incroyablement effervescente (je ne crois pas avoir déjà vu une autre bière aussi effervescente!), et surmontée d’un col blanc, moyennement large, léger, aérien, nuageux, bien résistant et très collant sur les parois du verre. Arômes de pain frais et de blé, beaucoup de fruité (agrumes, pêche, pomme verte, framboise, raisin vert…), levure belge typique des bières saison, et levure sauvage et acide également. Présence aussi d’effluves herbacés et aromatiques (gazon, foin, menthe, coriandre, conifère…), quelques épices également (surtout du poivre…). Très beau nez, très intense, belle complexité. En bouche, bien pétillante, mais pas tant que ça considérant l’effervescence observée, breuvage également bien mousseux, mais c’est plutôt assez mince au palais. Au goût, on note dès la première gorgée que c’est malheureusement significativement moins intense en bouche qu’au nez, et que l’acidité, même s’il reste largement dans le domaine du tolérable, domine sans partage. On a de légères saveurs de pain fais, foin et blé, mais aucune saveurs véritablement sucrées. Moins fruité qu’au nez, on retrouve néanmoins les agrumes (citron et pamplemousse blanc surtout) et léger de pomme verte et de raisin vert. On retrouve également l’herbacé et l’aromatique en bouche, ainsi qu’une subtile touche poivrée. Tel que mentionné précédemment, moins intense en bouche qu’au nez, un peu moins complexe également, bien accessible cependant, rafraîchissante, ça fait très estival. Au final, une très bonne bière!
Served from large bottle. Tight lace, with light yellow hue. Flavors of wine, cereal, and hops. Acidic and sweet a little too sweet. Best Saison ale I have tasted.

Bottle (2013), 355ml. A golden beer with a huge frothy head. It has a floral aroma and maybe a slightly hint of banana. Taste is bitter at the beginning but also a little sour at the end. Maybe it has a slightly watery finish, but overall a good beer. Very complex.

Bottle, 355ml (2013). Pours clear golden with plenty of carbonation and a thick, fluffy white head with great retention. Aroma is of coriander/orange and other citrus, with a musky barnyard character and yeast. Spicy and astringent, with a heavy bitter and sour finish expertly balanced. Complex and very drinkable, though nothing too special.

Golden color with a white tin head. Aroma is fruity, lemon, orange and grass. Taste is fruity and grassy with a citrus note. Not my type of beers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from 12 oz bottle into pint glass.

Appearance: pours a thin white had which leaves some mild lacing. Color is a cloudy yellow.

Aroma: coriander, yeast, bread dough.

Mouthfeel: crisp, light and frothy with a somewhat dry finish.

Flavor: complex combination of fruit, spices, vanilla, and sweet citrus rind.

Overall: very well done farmhouse ale.

765ml ($9.99) pretty good beer and tastes like a belgian style beer and has a high level of carbonation like a champagne. its good but at the price point its closely priced to better beers in the same style and this is only 6.5% abv
2013 edition. Fruity sweet aroma. Pours clear straw with lots of rising bubbles. Sweet flavors with a bit of woodsiness at the end.

Murky yellow with a white head. Aroma contains some lemons, spices, and white grapes. The flavor is sour and tart with a strong citrus flavor. The aftertaste is very tart and sour more so than most saisons. Overall a good beer.

2014/06/01 - Pours a translucent, golden/honey colour with a soapy white head that quickly dissipates. Aroma is yeast, citrus, orange, funk and mild vanilla. Taste is yeast, Brett funk and tangy orange/citrus with white wine, oak and peppery notes. Mouthfeel is light, with effervescent carbonation and a refreshing, drying finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Une bière complexe, très fruité et facile à boire. Il faut que je ré-essaye et en garde une dans la cave pour plus tard.

A light, refreshing take on a saison. The aroma is heavy on the fruit and yeast, very inviting. The flavor is all over the place, but still quite good. Dry champagne mixed with orange, yeast, and a little funk. Low ABV and light on the spice notes for the style.
Good example of saison style. For me cooler in creation than in actual outcome. Tart and dry slightly overwhelms other qualities.
Pours a mostly clear light amber color with fizzy off-white head. Light citrus and some vanilla on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with a little tartness, and very dry.
la description de la bière ne me donnais pas le choix de l’acheter, bon choix, une saison de haute qualité et facile à trouver. Le gout est complexe mais tout en douceur.
On tap at Redwood Cafe. Pours a hazy straw color with a lot of frothy head. Wild yeast flavors but a little sweet. Citrusy.

From bottle. Pours a hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of Belgian yeasts and a touch of citrus. Taste is the same, perfectly sweet, no real hops. There is a little bit of funk there in the background. Medium mouthfeel and good carbonation. This is a delicious brew.

Bomber to a tall pilsner. Pours hazy straw color with frothy white head, good lacing and loads of effervescence... Fruit and spice on the nose, white grape (Chardonnay ?), orange zest and white pepper... The palate is Brett funk, tangy, tart, citrus, white grape and some oakiness. Light and refreshing, great beer!

Pours a clear golden color with a nice frothy had and great lacing. Aroma is clean, fresh, zesty. You get some good yeast notes definitely some citrus and lemon. Some have said coriander but I would go with more orange and pepper. Flavor is initially bready and pepper. But you get some nice lemon in there as well. There is a slight fruitiness to that citrus zest that goes on with maybe even some wheat. Mouthfeel is sweet and dry. Carbonation is average. This is a great beer.
Clear pale golden color, fluffy white head. Sweet, malty, fruity scent. Phenolic, yeasty taste. Medium mouthfeel. Sweet aftertaste.

Visited Goose Island at Clybourn and got a tasting flight. Tasting notes include:

excellent flavor, sweet white wine, very clean
On tap. Pours a clear golden color with white lacing. Aroma is Brett, lemons and white wine sweetness. Flavor is funky, with mild lemon sourness, white grape tang, and brettanomyces. Quenching.

バランスよく濃いめのビールに仕上がっている
