グースの高級路線のビールのなかでは、一番美味しいかも
Bottle to tulip - frosty lemon color, huge chunky head. Has a nice lemon flavor. Medium body and a spicy finish. Pretty refreshing beer.

Bouteille 750ml. Bière jaune avec une mince couche de mousse blanche. Un nez de vin blanc, de fleurs blanches avec un peu de citron. Des notes de levure sauvage sont bien présentes et agréables. La bouche est parfaitement digeste. Facile à boire et rafraichissante. Belle addition dans le monde de la bière au Québec.
Tap. Crisp and sweet. Pours clear straw color with thin head. Nose is fruity and bread. Peach and apricot. Taste is mostly sweet with a little sour aftertaste.
Great lacing on the glass. Fine fruity aroma. Fantastic velvety mouth-feel that goes down smoothly. Complex tastes between spices and fruits.
Really nice saison. Slight peppery and citrusy. Subtle sourness. Enjoyed this very much.

Pours the color of golden straw with a bubbly white head. Loads of carbonation, as the bubbles just keep coming. The smell may be my favorite thing about this beer. Yeast, grape, a bit of wood and brett. Light mouth with a crisp fizz. At first taste, I wasn’t terribly impressed. But as it warms - and I mean really warms - the flavor really pops.
light funk aroma. appearance is golden and crystal clear, very foamy head. taste is crisp smooth, slight spice, slight citrus flavors.
Delicious and tasty beat drank with chicken or fish. Worth the higher price tag sucks to have to drink it in.one sitting.though

A damp yeasty aroma. Quite bubbly on the palate. Some vanilla but faint words words words

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 2013 Aroma of slight citrus, sugar, sour smell. Taste is sour to slight spice, yeasty. Carbonation is the best part, constant stream from the bottom of a belgian glass. Good beer!

Location: 12 oz bottle from Buy Rite, 4/13/14, 2012 Bottle, Bottled on 8/22/12




Aroma: It has a really nice Belgian yeast aroma, some citrus, spice, and a some clean malts as well


Appearance: Bright orang pour, somewhat hazed, light, frothy, white head, with a drippy lace


Flavor: The taste is much the same, lots of yeast and spice, some citrus notes, and a light bitterness


Palate: It has a decent mouthfeel, with too much carbonation, and a mid-dry yeast/spice finish


Overall Impression: 
Have I really never rated Sofie?  I thought this was a more than solid Saison.  It has a good Belgian yeast feel, decent spice, and an alright finish.  I have enjoyed this beer in the past, and it is surely a good beer.
Hazy yellow in appearance with a white head. Aroma is sour fruity. Taste is sour and fruity with a hint of onions, Mouthfeel is light and fluffy.

Nice golden colour with small white head. Smells like pear. Not overly effervescent. Very smooth nice belgian year character, sweet and slightly phenolic. Tasty but prefer some of the other Good Island Belgians.

I’ve had Sofie a few times before and I love it. This time served out of 765ml bottle at a little over a year and a half old.

Aroma- Pilsner malt (buscuit), white pepper, pineapple, lemmon, rotten white grapes

Appearance- Deep hazy yellow golden

Taste- Very different from my first few experiences. Very tart and chardonay and champagne like this time arround. Big dry citrus bite.

Mouthfeel- Very very dry. Creamy and dry at the same time. Really awesome. 

Finish- Tart, dry, finishes like a dry white wine

From a bottle pours hazy gold with fluffy white head, aroma is lemon, with wet hay and a little funk. Taste is inline with the smell, some citrusy lemon and bitter orange, honey like malt that finishes with an acidic tartness. Mouthfeel is medium body with high carbonation.

750ml. Pours out a bright yellow color with a large white head. Body is lively, full of carbonation. Smell is malty, citrusy, some wine. Taste is smooth, refreshing when fully chilled but as it warms the citrus and wine notes really come out. Fucking good beer this one is. I don’t care who owns them, this ranks up with DuPont.

Really nice saison. Bright yellow pour, with a brilliant white head. Great spicy, citrusy nose, and a slight peppery bite on the tongue. Effervescent mouthfeel. Not exotic or exciting, but a really solid beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Light and refreshing. Pours a light hay yellow thin white head. Tart wine citrus hay aroma. Some orange hint of white wine well balanced. Hint of tart fruit. Light body light to medium carbonation.
Liquide légèrement ambrouillé tirant du blanc ou blond. Arôme typique de bière belge. Côté épicé et fruité. Acidité plaisante en bouche. Plein de subtilité.

Pours pale yellow with a thick foamy head that lasts forever. Aroma mild citrus with some cloves. Floral notes as well. Light to medium body with a lively carbonation. Flavor pretty mild is mild and it works! You can certainly taste the belgian yeast, and the orange peel becomes more apparent towards the finish, and as the beer warms up. Almost reminds me of a white wine in a strange way. Either way, fantastic beer. Would drink again.

draft pale hazy yellow color with white head. aroma of mucho bananas, bubble gum and yeast and bread. yet all very light...the flavor is much more of the same. lots of bananas and yeast and light bread...very sweet to the nose and yet mild on the tongue. almost evervescent in flavor...lots of carbonation. I did get a feel for some citrus in the mix yet mild enough and very good.

Bottle pours hazy pale yellow, with an effervescent white head. Aroma of clove, belgiany spices, caramel, peach, slight hay and a bit of yeast funk. Taste is belgiany spices, fruit, bitter front with a tart sweet finish. Medium light body.

bottle from local iga grocery A: mango, pineapple, pear, funky app: hazy pale white head. t/p: thin body wth light acidic finish. fizzy o: so good. like the fruitiness/funkiness. I can only hope this one remain a regular has it will be dangerously good poolside.
Smooth and light taste and look. Light citrus and very smooth. Would definitely buy again.

Gushing léger à l’ouverture. Couleur paille légèrement trouble, avec une mousse blanche cottonneuse et tenace. En nez, arômes de levures sauvages, d’agrumes (surtout du pamplemousse) et de l’acidulé intense. En bouche, sèche et désaltérante, fruitée et complexe, plus du moins qu’annoncée en nez. Excellente saison, assez accessible pour être une bonne introduction au style, mais d’une profondeur intéressante et de qualité suffisante pour le buveur aguerri.

765ml bottle. Pours a hazy pale yellow with a good sized white cap. Aroma is heavy with dry apple cider like notes, light cotton candy, light moscato like notes, light lemon, and paraffin. The taste has floral notes, cider heavy characteristics, noticeable moscato like notes, and light bitterness up front that leads into Belgian yeast, white grape juice, and mineral notes in the finish. Perfect champagne like carbonation. This is excellent stuff. Thumbs up!

Not sure where to begin with this. I had seen this beer once in local paper being reviewed and always wanted to try, even saw it at LCBO for longest time but never pulled the trigger. Well got a bottle to try finally. So, pours a light light cloudy pale yellow, with some carbonation. aroma is citrus, grapes, almost a hint of wine to it. sip is tart, I don’t get vanillla, after taste to it, almost makes me think wine. Interesting but will not buy again.

Lots of floral and citrus aroma, taste is fairly complex with banana and bread! , not your average beer 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Great spring summer beer. Large floral notes with a citrus sweet flavor on the tongue. A slight tart and champagne feel on the palate. enjoyable, one of my preferred beers from goose island. reminiscent of the Festina Peche from dog fish head.

28/II/14 - 12Fl. Oz. bottle @ home - BB: 21/I/16 (2014-225) Thanks to Nathan for the bottle!


Clear pale yellow beer, aery irregular white head, dissipates quickly, non adhesive. Aroma: very dirty, unpleasant, artificial bretta, lemony. MF: soft carbon, medium to light body, weird slick oily texture. Taste: dirty start, artifical bretta, rotten fruits, lemony, fruity touch as well, you sort of get used to it, but not really. Aftertaste: lemony, little bitter, peaches, overripe banana peel, orange peel, floral, some honey. Nope, this isn’t cutting it for me...
Draft. Citrus bitterness with yeast. Bready, banana, cloves and yeast flavors. The yeast coats the mouth.

Pours a pale yellow. Slight haze. Long lasting white head. Smells of apricot, peach and urine(in a good way). Funky aroma. Taste of banana and peach, with a peppery finish. The Belgium yeast shines through and is the star of the show.
A pleasant farmhouse ale with an aroma reminiscent of fields of recently cut wheat. Has a sweet and slightly bitter long finish and a golden color.

Nouveauté au Québec. Bière de couleur jaune paille, avec une mousse généreuse qui la chapeaute. Nez très intéressant d’eau de rose, de fruits tropicaux, d’ananas mûrs. En bouche, c’est puissant et complexe. Les arômes sont vraiment intéressants et difficiles à décrire : néanmoins, je sens la présence des agrumes, des pommes vertes, du poivre rose et de l’ananas auxquels se mélange un goût de levure belge particulièrement bien. Il y a un petit côté Brett ou encore qui rappelle le cuir, mais beaucoup moins prononcé que dans la Matilda de la même brasserie, que j’ai moins appréciée d’ailleurs. Excellent produit, peut-être un peu coûteux mais qui vaut la peine. Je vais la racheter sans aucun doute malgré son coût de 10 $. Cheers!.

Bottle. Straw/orange with very large frothy white head. Aroma of Belgian notes, pear, and citrus. Light body with pear, yeast, light spice notes, and a hint of hop bitterness. Finishes with a slight sour finish. Very nice.
Belle découverte nouvellement distribuée par ici... Ce que je préfère de ce produit est son parfum fuité, sa belle acidité bien dosée et sa finale qui se complexifie graduellement.

Very pleasant saison, pouring clear with appropriate carbonation. Some funkiness and on the dry side, with residual yeastiness which lingers. Just a bit on the sour side, pepper does come through without any other spice or citrus to detract.
First time trying something from Goose Island and blown away. Great beer and looking forward to Matilda.

Très surpris pas la qualité du produit. Une saison claire, aux notes d'orange légèrement acide, mais sucrée à la fois. Le goût est franc, belle complexité des saveurs, balancée et avec une finale soyeuse. Elle se démarque des autres saisons que j'ai l'habitude de boire. A decouvrir

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ha ! Amère, surette, pétillant fin, c’est une jolie bière. Le floral du houblon avec le suret donne un goût qui est proche de celui de la lime; pulpe et zest. C’est ce qui m’est revenu à l’esprit tout le long de l’expérience. Il s’agit bien d’une touche de suret, qui vient seulement casser la rondeur de la bière et étirer sa présence en bouche. Plaisant !

Saison being one of, if not completely, my favorite styles, I was surprised that I had not known about this one before it popped up in my grocery store. The biggest distinguishing factor of this beer was that it was tart. Not super tart like the fantome saison I’ve had (Thanks mike), but a tier below that. The flavors were complex, but not powerful. I usually like my saisons to have a ton of yeast flavors, but this one chose to use the yeast more towards the tart end, which gave a greater array of flavors. The beer also finished fairly smooth for a saison, but had some bit in the middle. Like hennepin, I feel that sofie is a good "first saison" because it is safe.

12oz bottle poured into a whisky glass. A very fruity and bread-aroma initially hit the nose. The fruit aspects come off as peach, apricot, grape, and apple juice. There’s also some vanilla and floral notes, and later on, a caramel aroma comes through. It pours a clear, pale straw color with a thin, fizzy white head that reduces quickly leaving behind a dishwater film. There’s an light lacing. The taste is mostly sweet with some light sour and bitter aspects. It has a decent umami quality to it that shows up at the finish. The medium/medium-full body is oily/slick with a flat carbonation. The taste is mostly caramel with some bittersweet orange peel. It finishes clean with some floral, and spice notes as well as a fatty quality. Doesn’t leave a notable aftertaste.
Très fruités (agrumes, raisin vert ). Explosion fruitée et très rafraîchissante.Bien houblonné avec une saveur de levure sauvage, de pommes vertes persistante. Une légère acidité. Superbe !!

Bière d’un jaune éclatant avec un col blanc mousseux. Au nez cette bière peut nous faire penser a une blanche au blé a la coriandre rafraîchissante. En bouche effectivement c’est rafraîchissant céréales,agrumes,coriandre. Honnêtement je ne vois pas pourquoi cette bière est si bien évalué. Une bière dans les standard qui ne révolutionne rien. Bien balancé mais sans plus.
Pours orange yellow and cloudy. Fruity aroma with pepper, vanilla, and wood. Tart flavor with pepper, grape, lemon, orange, and vanilla. Very flavorful. Nice beer.

Bouteille 765 ml. 6.5%. Couleur jaune foncé, mousse blanche. Arôme de levures sauvages, et un peu d’agrumes. En bouche, grains, levures, un peu d’agrumes, poivre doux, épices. Finale avec un peu d’herbes et amertume, acidité légère et rafraîchissante. Très bonne.

2013- Pours orange with a lot of minute flocculation and a small head. Aroma is funky- big apricot and lemon notes, burlap, dirt, brie, manure, and black pepper. Flavor is tart lemon, hay, wood, bready yeast, pepper, distant basil, and a tacky dry bit that ends grassy. A very elegant and spot-on version of the style. Very good, and very accessible.

From a 12ozer, bottled on 18JUN13. Nose is alarmingly fruity, heavy jammy marmalade, principally orange, with fruity yeast and lovely white pepper, white grape, muscat, floral, some honey and vanilla, classic Saison. Pours golden with a soapy white head. Crisp, honeyed taste, lightly sweet with juicy citrus and jam, leaning a bit exotic though not quite, and a pleasant bit of mild rind with soft wood and luscious fruit right up the middle. Tannic bite is rounded and helps with volume, wheat is done juuust right and blends with the tartness.  The wilder and potentially chaotic elements are downplayed, but what is emphasized is worthy -- very full and complex. The spicy and occasional hoppy flourishes are harmonious contributors.  Medium body is oily, slightly warming. Amazing that the US now has ready access to something like this. [2014.02.03: 4.0]

750mL bottle bottled on 30JAN14, here over a year-and-a-half later.  Mildly, very slowly gushy, but the glass is 90% foam, bright white and rocky, above clear yellow-golden.  Same flora/citric Saison nose as the last time, still fresh with a touch of wood amid the strong orange.  Oily in the mouth, slightly warming, dash of white pepper, sunny malty disposition.  Very vibrant and fresh, growing pineapple, lemon, very faint hint of musk (not quite vomit) in the deep bg, but the overall impression is squeaky clean and fresh, lively.  Vanilla and honey have faded, there’s a slightly more pronounced phenolic character [perhaps because some other obscuring elements have faded], and there’s even a jammy/berry character I haven’t noticed before.  Little bit foamy/gassy, but smooth and comforting, and man if that pineapple hasn’t taken off for the stratosphere!  Lightly tart, a touch warming/boozy, floral and somewhat rustic, beautiful and elegant.  No reason to drink these fresh when aged bottles are so magnificent.  [2015.10.02: 4.2]

765 ml bought at an IGA in Saint-Janvier (Mirabel, Quebec) on January 29, 2014. Blonde misty cream, small head. Aroma of sweet spice and pineapple, a bit hoppy. Wheat taste with citrus and pineapple slightly spicy, easy to drink. This beer gives me too the taste of summer!
Tart and complex with a slight orange zest note, some coriander and cardamom spice, and pretty straight forward pale malt. Has a dry, boozy mouthfeel with many tannins.

(inbev version) Aroma:spicy and cat pee..
Appearance:Light hazy yellow,light head...
Flavor:light floral flavor,cat pee.. nothing spécial from this beer...
Smells like a hairy dirty jock strap. Tastes like a sweet nectar for the gods. This was a very good beer.

Bottle, with a story behind it. About 4 years ago my kids kindergarten group gave their teacher a box of beer from each country they came from. I sourced the beer, lots of crap in it, this one represented my kids best mate. Shared it with Tom tonight. Stood the test of time well. Light lemon orange with a thin head. Dry wheat aroma, Spicy sour wheat, vanilla on a dry Belgian citrus finish.

Bottle at a tasting at Beer&Beyond shop. Clear golden with a decent white head. Aroma- fruity, floral and spicy. Taste - fruits, orange zest, tart, wood, grapes. Light-medium bodied, well carbonated. Nice.

Un joli collet de mousse blanche qui a tendance à se sauver rapidement plane au-dessus d’une robe de couleur jaune paille. Assez trouble, elle dégage des esters très fruités (agrumes, raisins blancs) et très vifs. On croirait respirer un bon Chardonnay. L’explosion fruitée et très rafraîchissante se poursuit en bouche, les houblons travaillant fort avec la levure sauvage, procurant ainsi des saveurs d’agrumes et de pommes vertes. Une légère acidité rend chaque gorgée agréable et les céréales (orge et blé) procurent un petit goût sucré tout en douceur. Une bière passe-partout parfaite!

Pours yellow with a nice creamy head. Aroma is sharp tangy yeast. Flavor is peppery and tart with a sweet dry finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Had it on tap at Goose Island Brew Pub. Not a huge saison fan, so with that in mind this ain’t bad. Clear yellow color light head and smooth and sparkly going down the gullet.

765ml bottle. Hazy straw yellow with a foamy white head. Aroma is bready malts, citrus, pineapple, peach, spices with subtle brett notes. Taste is bread, honey, white grapes, wood and grassy hops. Light body, moderate carbonation, soft texture.

Bomber bought at Super 1 in CDA, ID. I found this in the discount cart for only $4.98! 2010 vintage, before they completely sold out--yeah baby! Aroma is packed with bretty goodness: dust, citrus rind, barnyard funk, cheese, earth. Pours pale hazy yellow with a giant white soapy head that takes its sweet time receding, leaving lace. Taste is dry, sour (4/10 on a sour scale) and a bit savory. Has a hoppy presence in the finish after it warms up a bit. Bit of an alcohol burn in the finish, even with the relatively low ABV. Highly carbonated, giving it a foamy mouthfeel, medium-bodied. This is really good, but it would be better without the foamy mouthfeel, being more finely carbonated. What a find, though.

765ml bottle. Pours a straw yellow with a two inch white head that slowly collapses. Taste is of wood, wine, fruit, yeast, citrus and spice. Similar, cleaner aroma. Has a watery body with a slight dry finish. Not bad, but not worth it.

Bottle thanks to Brian (not on ratebeer). Sampled on January 19, 2014.
Clear pale golden color, fluffy white head. Sweet, malty, fruity scent. Phenolic, yeasty taste. Medium mouthfeel, medium mouthfeel. Sweet aftertaste.

Elle a l’ir d’une blanche avec son apparence blonde paille, tirant sur le grisâtre, ayant une mousse de boisson gazeuse qui se résorbe rapidement en laissant quelques traces. Un bon nez de levures poivrées et légèrement sauvages. Je sent aussi un conglomérat d’agrumes parsemés d’épices, dont je n’arrive pas à définir avec précision. Des parfums floraux et boisés sont aussi humés. À la première gorgée, malgré qu’elle nous laisse sur une impression aqueuse, elle a amplement le temps de nous imprégner de toutes ses qualités gustatives. C’est pratiquement dans le même ordre que ses arômes. On reste sur une belle impression minérale qui transporte la pulpe d’orange et ça a pour effet que je ne pense qu’à une boisson Orangina™ (Embouteillée le 18 mars 2013)(959-050114)

My first saison; not being a big fan of champagne, as the label recommends, means I do not find this beer suiting my personal tastes too much, that being said I do appreciate the experience of this unique offering from Goose Island. Gold and bubbly with a spicy vinous aroma. Complex fruit flavors with a recognizable barrel-aged accent. Lots of citrus. Impressive, my only criticism is that the high-carbonation texture distracts from the flavor and almost frustrates my effort to discern subtleties in the taste. Finishes very much like a champagne. This won’t be a regular purchase of mine but perhaps could suite a special occasion well.

750 into HF stemware. Super pale yellow, crystal clear. Aroma is white wine, citrus, yeast. Taste differs quite a bit. Clove, bananas, earthy yeast. High carbonation, very dry. Don’t think I’ll finish the bottle.

Signorina elegante e sofisticata questa Sofia. L’aroma unisce note citriche e più propriamente fruttate, con tentazioni acidule. Il gusto conferma un’acidità leggero, legata ai sentori di limone e frutta acidula (come la mela, infatti potrebbe lontanamente ricordare un sidro bretone). Finale molto ricco e coinvolgente, con una leggera svolta floreale ed erbacea. L’anima frizzante esalta certamente il gusto.

765ml de la lcbo. Blonde et même blanche. Belle mousse blanche qui colle au verre. Nez: intense de levure sauvage. Citronné. Epicé. Boisé. Bouche: Très effervescente (champagne). Légère. Fraiche. Fruité. Citron. Agrume. Épicé. Muscade. Poivrée. Levure sauvage bien présente. Excellente.

750 ml bottle. Pours a slightly hazy straw with a creamy, resilient white head. Aroma is grains, oldish, vanilla and lemon. Flavor is orchard fruit (peach, pear, apple), vanilla, fresh milky cream, white bread. Finish is lemon, fruity, herbal. Lingering fresh lemon. Light to medium body, soft mouthfeel, average to strong carbonation. Great!

This may not be the farmhouse ale that you want or expect. You see, Sofie opts for fruity and refreshing rather than yeasty and earthy. That takes some getting used to. What doesn’t take getting used to is the attractive golden appearance, the pure white head, and the phenomenal citrus aroma. That citrus influence plays a huge part in shaping the flavor, as well. Those lemon/orange notes are tart, sweet, and even a bit sour in the finish. An unconventional farmhouse that’s uncommonly refreshing and approachable.

On 06/18/2011. 2011 Vintage. Somewhat cloudy golden body with a small frothy white head. Sweet fruit and floral aroma. Sweet fruit, floral notes and caramel flavor. Medium body with moderate carbonation.

I had this beer right after having a Matilda. It had more of a complex bite. I just didnâ€™t like it as much (still a great beer), maybe that will change the further down the road I go. I still have a hard time with floral hints--Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle.

A- Citrus, spices.

A- Golden color, hazy liquid, white head.

T- Yeasty, citrus, spices, grapes.

P- Medium body, average texture, high carbonation, skunky finish.

O- The wild yeast and wine barrel aged makes this interesting to say the least. The flavors were very odd.

765ml bottle. 2013. Pours a beautiful hazy golden-white body, medium white head with good retention. A very refined and delicate aroma: yeast, lots of oranges, caramel, floral hops, wheat, banana, coriander, watercress. Taste is crisp and refreshing: watercress, yeast, oranges, banana, some malt sweetness, coriander. A very fine drink!

Bottle. Slightly hazy straw color. Citrus and wild yeast aroma. Nice citrus taste up front with a crisp finish. Good stuff.

-- rated with beerbasher

Pours slightly hazy with a nice clean head. The aroma is what caught me off guard initially - very citrusy with undetones of apple and pear. The flavour is well balanced and matches the aroma nicely. Not too sweet and very drinkable. Good Stuff.
This beer caught me off guard with its vibrant citrus start and crisp finish. Absolutely fantastic.

Bottle at dinner in Akron. Poured into a pint glass. Cloudy yellowish haze with a thick white head. Some lacing. Aroma of citrus like lemon and orange, wild funky yeasts, white pepper comes through, and the base is a little bready smelling. The taste is crisp with orange, Belgian wild yeasts, hint of pine, wine, and other herbs. Clean, crisp finish is a little tart and funky. Heavy carbonation. Good saison.

Bottle from 2012. The aroma blends sour fruit, orange peel, and Belgian yeast, and the appearance has a cloudy golden color with a large white head and dark fine-grain sediment. The taste is very nice with a heavy sweetness balanced out with a mild sourness, creating a tartness; this flavor is balanced out with the palate’s medium body, lively carbonation, thin texture, and a finish that is lightly sweet.

A super wheaty beer that I way over hyped. Similar To a Hefer weizen and pours a cloud yellow. Having this one at Calos in Andersonville 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

With two years of age, higher levels of effervescence both help and harm this brew, mostly for the better, sharp carbonation bites as the mellow, rich melon and grass components dance over delicate layers of hay, wet oak, and white wine, faint white pepper and flowers... score increases from 3.6 to 3.8



Original review 12/14/2013 :



A frothy tight white head persists for several minutes on a very slightly hazed sunny light straw body producing a few splatters of lace



The aromas offer a more vivid perspective on light hay and earth over white vinous notes with faint floral accents on a clean, silky smooth body with very restrained carbonation for the style, slightly sweet vinous residuals build complimenting the earthy yeast tones followed with a touch of white pepper to finish out, pleasant, mildly complex, and very approachable



12oz bottle code 13AUG13 1301 at 45º into 15.5oz Stölzle Weinland water glass

Smells like a nice beer. Non homogenous appearance throughout. Light, bubbly on the edges. Taste is lighter, straight-forward, very clean. Palate light and fruity. I found this beer in a 750 mL bottle at my local Costco. Beautiful bottle and nice to give as a gift for sharing and celebration. Very drinkable, could drink a whole bottle in one sitting myself.

Pours a slightly cloudy light gold color with a short, white, microbubble head. Light and clean, with some tart citrus esters emanating from the glass. The texture begins soft, but quickly becomes lively with carbonation. Some clean grapefruit flavor up front followed by an emerging earthiness. One of the nicer saison a I’ve had.

Bottled 15AUG12, 1314

Pours light gold with a solid quilt of bone white foam. Smells good, really good. Fruit, maybe honeydew, some peach, wheat, leaves, yeast cake, co2, bits of lemon and funk. I like the nose here. Taste is clean, slightly tart, some grain and corn, a bit of bitterness, some clay, and funk. Medium bodied with prickly, but low carb and an off dry finish. Nice beer, wonder how it develops.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours gold with a white head. Taste citrus, spice, yeast. I thought this was pretty good. I would definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at Beer Study. Pours a bright orange golden with a thick white head. Nose is light pepper, citrus, earthy malt. Flavor is similar--one of the better "straight up" American saisons around. Easy drinking and pleasant. Nice to have this available all the time here.

5/66/2012 vintage. Rated 11/28/13. Pours an unclear light yellow with an orange tinge. Medium fluffy white head. Aroma is light citrus, yeast, touch peppery, soft woody. Flavor is much the same. Citrus, lemon, yeast, peppery, woody. Lighter bodied but not thin. Nicely carbonated with a little crisp bite. Finish is indeed creamy, maybe a touch of dryness. Smooth, tasty, and easy drinking. Very enjoyable.

5/16/12 vintage. Very light, yeasty, citrus aroma. A touch of spice. Similar taste. light, a little carbonation, good amount of lemon citrus yeast, a little spice. 
So light, almost understated, but delicious beer.

Beautiful light golden pour with a fluffy white head. Ridiculous balance. Refreshing and drinkable. This would be my ideal beer on warm summer evening. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A nice farmhouse, but not our favorite Goose Island. Pours an ugly yellow with a white head. Smells like white wine and lemongrass. Taste is very lemony and light, with the classic farmhouse undertones. Good, not great. Had on tap at Billcos.

&#045;&#045;-Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This beer has a golden yellow appearance with a very thick head. It has an aroma of white wine and lemon peel. It has a spicy flavor of cloves and finishes with the flavor of lemongrass. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle. Pours brilliant golden with short-lived white head and lively carbonation. Aroma is of funky yeast, biscuit malt, pears, apples and herbal hops. Body is full and crisp. Taste is of funky yeast, spices, peppery hops, biscuit malt and ripe fruit. Finish is long and spicy. Overall it is nice brew.

Bottle: 2013
Pours hazy yellow-gold with a short, white head.
Lemon, yeast aroma.
Lemon, vanilla flavour...very soft...
Fruity, light and refreshing, yet with a slight musty character.
Good.....very good.

pours hazy pale yellow with a frothy and creamy white ehad, excellent retention and lacing. leathery and dusty bretts, tropical burst - pineapple shining, peppery - maybe more pink than white pepper - lol, ginger, chewy and bready pale malts, wheat, white wine, light woodsy notes. bright carbonation, almost foamy, light body, dry and slightly astringent herbal-grassy-tropical-citrusy finish. excellent!

Bottle, thanks sevenhokie! Sour, citrusy aroma with peppery notes. Pours hazy, straw colored with two fingers of white head and not much lacing. Pepper and citrus to start followed by a smooth slightly sour finish. Good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a light yellow hazy appearance. Loads of orange and yeast on the nose. Carbonation tickles the mouth as a bit of tartness to go with the sweetness balances it out. Pleasantly surprised by this one.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home, shared with Mathieu87. This years release.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: hops, citrus, alcohol, wood.
TASTE: wood, alcohol, hops, not that much taste in general.
Though, looking forward to drinking this one aged!

12 oz. May 2012 bottle. Pour is a beautiful light gold, slightly hazy. Big effervescent head, with decent staying power. Really nice aroma of yeast, clove and banana. Some orange and spice in there as well. Taste is less sweet than the aroma and much more tart. Starts out with the banana sweetness but quickly punches you with tartness and spice. Clove and apple flavors come through. Does get a bit sweeter as it warms. Mouthfeel is a nice middle ground between beer and champagne. A bit tart for me as far as saisons go but still enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rated on 9-05-2009 (Crown Liquors Event-Bottle) This beer pours a small white head with a short retention, hazy-cloudy pale yellow body, visible carbonation, and a fair amount of lacing. The Aroma is yeast, sweet, fruity, oak, citrus, and lightly spicy. The Taste mimics the Aromas. The Palate is tingly and this beer is light bodied. All-in-all, this beer is very quaffable, very, very enjoyable flavor, worth trying, and a beer I definitely will drink again.
2013 bottle. Has a slight saison spicyness without the banana. Touch of brett and a touch of sourness. More interesting than the typical saison.

Pours a clear straw color with a fluffy white head. Nice spicy and citrusy nose, little bit of barnyard funk, nice belgian yeast character, and some coriander. Taste has a lot of that same zesty citrus note from the orange peel, nice peppery spiciness, lemon, and a little bit of saison funk. Very muted flavors, especially for a wine barrel aged saison. It’s still tasty, but given what’s done to this beer it should be a whole lot better.

Appearance: Pours like a champagne with a white head
Aroma: Some coriander and lemon with a yeasty hefe nose
Taste: Yeasty notes, with orange peel and some pepper. Couldn’t find the barrel accents I was looking for. 
Overall: I was hoping for a more of a sour and I’m a big fan of Juliet. This is more for those looking for a Hefe with an spicy citrus kick.

A truly unique Saison beer. A nice alcohol balance with superb fermentation process in the bottle, like the champagne. The fermentation process develops in the bottle up to five years as this beer contains live yeast. The palate is soft and the after taste is excellent. Pair it with seafood or sushi.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This beer reminded me of a chardonnay, don’t know why. But I get a strong taste of sour apple and a little citrus. Medium body. A lot of carbonation. Semi sweet with a sour finish. Did not like this one

[Bottle, 2013] Murky sunshine yellow body with a soapy, bone white head that lasts as a nice chunky collar & swampy film. Aroma is bursting with fruit; lemon flesh, orange, peach, mild apricot, white grape, all backed my solid helping of farmhouse funkiness. Wet hay, cotton, slight sweaty & cheesy funk. Somewhat floral, faintly spicy & grassy hop character. Complex aroma. Taste includes much funk & fruit as well. Lemon peel, peach tones, musty hay, orange zest, hints of barnyard sweat funk, crisp melon, fresh grassy tone, slightly vinous white grapes & a strong bready, yeast filled finish. Lots of yeast. Chunky yeast body with a highly carbonated, crispy & dry finish. A great example of the style.



[Tap, 2013] I’ve found that Sofie actually loses a bit of it’s spunk on tap. Not sure if it’s the fact that it doesn’t receive full "bottle conditioning" (keg conditioning?) but it’s not quite as freshly funkified & thus loses a bit of it’s aforementioned brightness on tap as compared to cracking open a bottle. Less carbonated & lively as well. Still a good beer on tap, but fantastic in the bottle. My score will still represent the bottled versions.
Draft. Slightly hazy pale yellow. Minimal head. Slightly tart and dry with some funkiness. Pretty great stuff.
Pours almost clear out of the bottle with nice white fluffy head. Slightly tart flavor with dry finish. Didn’t taste the orange at all.

Bottle - 750ml. Hazy blond body with an average white frothy head. Fresh, well balanced hoppy aroma with malty, coriander, and citrusy hints. Its malty/hoppy taste carries yeasty, citrusy/orange, and herbal notes. Carbonation is light. Ends with a sharp bitter/sour finish. Well done.

Pours a hazy light yellow color with a small white head. Smell is funk, citrus, spice. Taste is as it smells with some light fruity sweetness then ending a bit dry and spicy. Light body with average carbonation level.

Cheers brah, JoeMcPhee. Clear golden pour with a large frothy white head. Medium carbonation. Yeast, herb and citrus aroma. Clean, crisp refreshing ale. Yeast, spice herb flavour. Sweet fruity citrus finish.

A: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Most Light, White Head, Minimal Lacing

S: Lemon, Yeast, White Pepper

T: Lemon, Yeasty, Sage, Mild Pepper

M: Decent Carbonation, Light to Medium Bodied, Semi Dry, Semi Sweet

Overall, an average saison...not a huge seeker IMO.
Blonde paille, limpide, peu mousseuse, au nez fermier. En bouche, c’est ample, citronné, levuré. Toutes les saveurs sont au diapason; c’est très bon.
Light straw color with nice lacing white head. Light Fruit flavors with peppery finish. Good flavor, full finish for a fairly light body.

Sampled at Whole Foods during Goose Island Migration Week St Louis, paired with Wild Ophelia chocolates. It poured a mostly clear golden colour with white foam, long-lasting with lace. Crisp, grainy, less tart and spicy than Matilda, but still somewhat complex. Rising bread dough, fruity esters, pepper and clove phenols, vanilla notes from the oak barrel-aging. Very approachable and enjoyable, yet still possesses some edgy Belgian yeast aspects. Light body, spritzy carbonation, noble hop balance, dry finish, tasty. A good gateway drug to complex Belgian ales.
Tap at the Clybourn brewpub. Poured a light amber with a thin white head. The aroma is fruit and yeast. The flavour is medium to weak bitter with a a citrus fruit yeast palate.

Draft sampled at Goose Island Clybourn. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma of peppery saison yeast, citrus and light tart fruits. Flavour is light sweet, bitter and moderate acidic. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Clear yellow body with a small white head of densely packed bubbles. Slightly sour grape aroma with funky barnyard notes as well. Wheat in the flavor with a few sour notes before a dry finish.

This one pours out a bright golden yellow with a fluffy white head. The aroma is spot on for a saison with the spiciness from the yeast. It had a nice taste that was light and balanced with a hint of pepper. Honestly it was one the most enjoyable saisons I’ve had in a while. This one stays true to the style and I love it.

Large frothy head strong carbonation misty deep gold pour aromas yeast clove fruit cereal sugary touch the flavours lemon clove cereal a real wheat taste rich barley malt the finish not a crisp tasting ale but mainly smooth best tastes malt grain spice a fair ale for the class
Very tropical on the nose and taste. The Paradisi is better. But still a nice fruitiness and refreshing taste. Very drinkable yet almost a creamy texture.

Draft. Light yellow. Nice lacing. I detect some of that peppery flavor. One if the better ones

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From 12oz bottle. 

Pours a light yellow with white head that dissipated quickly. Fruity aroma with hints of tartness/sourness. That aroma did not lie. Other reviews noted that Sofie was close to a sour. It is. Sadly, I am not a fan of sours, so I just don't care for it. Sour fans will probably like it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft.
Explosive white head. Yellow, maize hue. 
Orange zest. Tame malts, pils sweet. Mild yeast. 
Creamy orange sickle. Mild Co2.
Well put together, excellent representation of style. Nothing crazy but really high quality flavors.

Bottle. My overall rating for this reflects a bit higher than the individual components. It doesn’t shine in any area but it works well together. Pleasant, balancing amounts of sweetness and light funk. A fair value at $12 or less a 4-pack. Very good for a commonly available beer, one of my go-tos when there’s nothing special out there.

Bouteille 750ml. Couleur dorée semi-translucide, mousse blanche crémeuse. Arôme floral, orange, levure, poivré léger. poire?, alcool. Goût de zeste d’orange, orange, floral, légère amertume, poivré en fin de bouche. Carbonation moyenne-faible, corps dense.

Definitely champagne-like. Thin piss yellow pour with small bubbles. Funky yeast smell, citrus, little spice. Flavor is similar-slight tartness. Love how crisp it is compared to other saisons! Great addition to the Florida market

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazy light yellow color with a small white head. Smell is funk, citrus, spice. Taste is as it smells with some light fruity sweetness then ending a bit dry and spicy. Light body with average carbonation level.

12oz bottle, Ridgeview Liquors Green Bay, at home ix2013. Dry and fruity, very Belgian indeed saison-tripel crossover: aroma of brett and citrus rind, taste well-balanced between orange peel, wood/oak notes, dry saison funk, white pepper and heavy dried fruits (peach, apple). ABV adds some additional weight, making this only so-so refreshing. 2nd convincing cover version in the Goose Island Belgian cover series after Matilde (+Pere Jacques, Pepe Nero).

22 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled 7/8/2010. Slow gusher upon opening. Pours hazy golden amber color with a nice 3 finger foamy and rocky white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice foamy lacing clings around the glass. Aromas of tart lemon, apple, pear, pepper, orange peel, pineapple, wheat, hay, floral, grass, clove, funk, and earthy yeast spiciness. Fantastic aromas with great complexity and balance of fruity and spicy yeast notes; with great strength. Taste of tart lemon, apple, pear, clove, pepper, orange peel, wheat, hay, grass, funk, and spicy yeast earthiness. Moderate earthy tartness/spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of tart light fruits, citrus peel, pepper, clove, hay, grass, wheat, light funk, and earthy yeast spiciness on the finish for a good bit. Fantastic balance and complexity of fruity/spicy yeast notes; with a great malt/spiciness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. High carbonation and medium bodied; with a very crisp, foamy, and moderately prickly mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is a fantastic wild yeast saison! Outstanding complexity and balance of fruity/spicy yeast and orange peel flavors; and very smooth and crisp to sip on. A highly enjoyable offering; and one of my favorite easily available wild saisons.

Bottle. Pours a pale golden color with a foamy head that fades slowly to nice lacing. Aroma of light citrus and fruity. Has some yeast and bit of spice in the background. Taste begins tart with some fruit and bit of spice. There is a slight bitterness and a dry finish. Light body, tart with a sparkling wine feel. Interesting beer for the style but I am not into sparkling types of wine.
Crisp, fresh, delicious. Tastes of apples, a little citrus, and champagne, a little sweet, a little tartness. Very nice.
Poured as a taster - aromas have egg, sweaty horse, and spicy tones. The flavors follow along with a tartness and spicy/creamy finish.

26.06.2013, 0,35l bottle (2013) @ Vintner Wine Market Café:

Slightly fizzy mediumlasting head. Aroma is fresh fruity, citrus, hay, citrus peel, yeast, apricot. Taste is fruity, slightly sour-ish, light malts, brett, oranges, citrus peel, hay, grass, leafs. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice one!

Lite and floral on the nose with a taste of honey and peaches. The head is a bit temperamental at first but goes down to about a finger. Overall a very nice beer, and I normally don?t like fruity beers.

765ml bottle. Pours a slightly translucent pale yellow with a one finger, bubbly white head that fades to a film. Mild carbonation rising. Mild lacing.
Aroma is crisp with notes of sugar, banana, and citrus orange.
Taste is a slightly sweet with a semi dry, slightly acidic, orange citrus aftertaste.
Low to medium body with a medium to high, bubbly carbonation. Refreshing mouth feel. Very nice and worth buying. Would like to see how it ages.

Thanks to Catherine Schlager from La Presse newspaper that recommended this beer.
Aroma: Very complex aroma. Orange, apple, pepper and spices including coriander and a lot of flower accents. Bonne palette d’arômes.
Appearance: Clear straw with white rocky head, mid size thickness and very long lasting. A discreet lacing is leaving it’s trace on glass.
Taste: Attack is definitely sweet with the majority of aroma notes sticking out. We can feel the touch of apples, orange with little pear notes. Very fruity with a little bitter finish. We find also a bit of cinnamon, pepper and a feel of apple syrup with a touch of salt. Mouth feel shows a light texture with a medium body and carbonation. Une bière à la complexité de saveurs remarquable.
Pours hazy straw color with a thin white head. Great aromas of grass, citrus, brett. Very light, very dry and flavors of orange, spice, rosemary. Very complex and very refreshing.

Pour is clear blond with white head and little lacing. Aroma of coriander, orange peel, winey ntoes. Taste has low sweetness, spciy, winey, little brett, dry finish, little bitterness. Low bod and nice carbonation. very good saison!

Bottle from Proof. Clear golden pour with a bubbly white head. Fruity Belgian yeast aroma, light funk, lemon and banana with a hint a peppery spice. Similar in flavor with a sweet finish and a touch of spice. Nice carbonation and body. Not too shabby.

Slightly tart, lemony Belgian Hefe. Nicely bubbly, champagne like texture. Good domestic Belgian alternative.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pale gold, very little head. Smells if fresh cut grass and bubblegum. Prickly carbonation in the mouth with yeasty backbone, some pepper and citrus. Dry finish. A champagne like beer that could win over people who don't think they like beer.
Pale yellow color with a white head. Citrus, coriander with some sweetness and a orange zest. There is a little bit of vanilla and and vinous flavors. Very good.

Draft. Pours yellow with white head into the GI flute at the Knick. Loads of bubblegum flavor and in the nose. Some herbal and grass notes with coriander and lemon. Rather dry with not much after. Pretty good.

Bottle pour slight hazy light yellow. Nose belgian spice, sugar, yeast. Taste sweet sugar, then clove, spice, some ester. Minimal bitter finish. Very drinkable, just a little less spicy than I prefer.

S: Lemon and lime peels, some cloves, white pepper, belgian yeast, citrus, melons and just a hint of oak. A very plesant smell, yet complex. P: A weird yellowish-color, with a very bubbly head. T: Lemons and cloves all the way around, some wine and orange peel. M: Super carbonation. O: Nicely done but the carbonation was way up there.

Big ass Likkkcbo bottle. Hazy yellow with a surprisingly small white head. Aroma is pretty solid and what I would expect from a real Saison. Citrus zing is there, but there’s a ton of interesting yeasty and somewhat dank characters, like it actually could have been made in a barn. Not like the shitty ’saisons’ that OCB members have been pumping out recently that are just glorified Witbiers. Flavour has a nice balance of the dry yeast characters with some sweet malty elements, and a nice tart lemon finish to round it all off. Ascending esters dominate the aftertaste. Again, so much more going on than the Ontario examples of this style. Brewers here should really take a lesson.
22oz bomber. Pours a cloudy light straw yellow color small creamy white head. Aroma of citrus rind, some wheat, and a hint of herbs. Taste is citrus, wheat, a bit of funk, and floral notes.
Floral, barnyard, earthy. Very light on the palate, I like that it doesn’t linger there too long so it leaves you urging for more. A great, refreshing drink that could be had often.

750 mL bottle from LCBO served cold in a tulip glass, shared with friends. Very cloudy bright golden with a fair, loose, bright white head. Nice barnyard character, Sauv. Blanc, fruity esters, nicely peppery and spicy, bitter green herbs, quite nice. Medium body, very lively effervescence. Peppery, estery, lightly wild, green herbs, citrus, what and cereals, lovely stuff; dry with gentle bitterness and a lovely estery, lightly funky finish. Masterful.

Bottle. Pours cloudy yellow with a small white head. Aroma of funk, citrus, some spicy notes, yeast and malt. Flavor is sweet and funky with some malt, peppery notes, hint of vanilla and fruitiness. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle 355ml @ Hotel Room, Bay Park Hotel, Monterey, CA

Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, yeast, orange, brett and hint of vanilla. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with a long funky, dry, pepper and orange finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle, 12oz. 2013 vintage. A hazy, yellow-golden body is topped by a creamy, finger-thick, white head. The aroma is brett-ish, with lemon notes, some farmyard, and a spiced touch. Quite carbonated, in a nice way, medium body, dry on the palate. Citrus peel, some peppery notes and a little funky touch in the flavor, and a very faint vanilla hint. Some woody feelings too. Decent bitterness that lasts for a while. Most certainly a good saison. 130808

Bottle, LCBO. Light to medium yellow, champagne like carbonation, huge foamy head that completely disappeared. Tart aroma - strong, smells great. Taste - really carbonated, sparkling wine like body. Peppery notes, lots of fruit, lots of yeast. Pretty nice beer!

An amazingly delicious and easily quaffable refreshing summer beer. Tastes fruity and dry. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2012 bottle. Pale light color, white/frothy head. Orange is slightly present, earthy, funk, bubbly, nice finish, pleasant and tasty.
Drank this one from the bottle before softball, very carbonated. Aroma is slight funk and spices, taste is light and dry with a tart and slight spice finish.. great summer beer!
Bottle. Musty lemon peel and light malt aroma. Hazy pale yellow with small head. Lightly sweet orange-lemon malt flavor. Very pleasant - easy drinking.

(765mL bottle from LCBO) Pours a hazy yellow-gold with a pillowy head of bubbly white froth. Aroma yeasty, slightly sour, citrus rind, fresh grassy herbs, earthy funky notes. Flavour is a bit white wine-like despite a relative lack of barrel character - fruity, particularly orange, a little acidic, yeasty dough, light white pepper/herbal spice, little bit of vanilla from the barrel and yeasty earth on the dry, lightly bitter and peppery finish. There’s a little tartness throughout on the palate, but not very sour or Brett-ish. Mouthfeel is light to medium with a slight oily cling, effervescent carb, on style. This is a good saison and the orange and barrel work well, but maybe a larger fraction of that in the blend would amp it up that extra bit.

Beautiful cloudy yellow straw color with massive tight foamy white head. Huge carbonation that looks like champagne. Aroma is present as soon as opened, sweet, sour and spicy. Citrus, floral, earthy, yeasty. Taste is citrusy with some grassy tropical notes and wine flavors. Clean finish. Great Belgian style ale.

765 mL Bottle. Murky straw body with a very frothy white head settling to a film leaving some cloudy lace. Intense yeasty aroma with floral - fruity notes, and fields of clover buddy up alongsides. Wow! And Flavah!!! Peach and pear with a sharpness of unripe green grapes subtly squelched by a butterscotch innuendo invade the taste buds, trailing off to a cream cheese finish. Heavenly!
Beautiful colour, malty, the head is very similar to champagne. The flavour profile is not quite as rich as I expected from its aroma, but it does have some nice hints of citrus.
Draft at Champps. Pours a hazy yellow with medium, fluffy, white head. Nose of orange peel, lemon, coriander, pepper, grain, vanilla. Medium body and carbonation. Lightly bitter finish.

Pours hazy yellow with low white head
Aromas of sour belgian yeast, citrusy fruits, coriander, wheat
Nice refreshing taste of mandarin, oranges and lemons.
Wee bit too sour even though it has a nice sweet character as well

A really strong beer. Reminds me of a poor mans anchorage love buzz saison.. Wine ie funky fruity and delicious

Bottle. Liked this one better than Matilda. Crisper and drier. Orange shows through, and the white pepper note is definitely there. Good stuff!
Delightfully murky amber color. Light hints of orange peel and what tasted like nutmeg aftertaste. Light flavor but not flavorless. Served in 765ml bottle poured to glass.

Pours golden yellow with a thin white head. Slightly tart aroma with a fruity body. Finishes tart and refreshing.

Bomber. Cloudy yellow, huge head. Bretty aroma, vinous. Taste is lightly tart, spice, banana. Pretty fucken good. Sorry I scrolled past this one for so long.

Nice flowery aroma mixed with yeast, and some fruit. Hazy pale yellow with very thin white head. Sour wheat, followed by citrusy fruit, and sweet orange. Finished with a nice peppery bitterness. Refreshing on a hot day.

2013 bottle picked up at the University plaza LCBO. Pours a hazy pure yellow, white head, clumps of lace, very active carbonation. Nose is funky, sweet, peppery, citrus, hops. Really easy to drink, and really tasty.

Pours bright gold with nice white head, pretty nice looking beer. Aroma is sour yeast and citrus. Dry, with a nice light to medium body. Funky sweet yeasty notes, Lots of lemon and citrus flavors. Little bit of spicy bitterness but not much. Very easy to drink and campaign like. Good.

2011 bottle. Pour is straw with a foamy white head. Aroma is bread, biscuit, orange, coriander, light pepper, yeast, lemon, slight sweet. Taste is orange and biscuit cracker, slight toast, lemon and honey like sweet, slight pepper and coriander, Belgian yeast funk comes through on a drier finish.

Pours a hazy golden with a white head. Ring of foam sticks around for most of the beer. Slight peppery bready notes on the nose. Not so much fruit on the nose. Mild carbonation. Typical belgian notes, slight funk. Decent citrus and nice bitter drying on the finish.

Bottle. Bright and slightly hazy sunshine-yellow with a big and frothy white head. Aroma is fresh and fruity with notes of citrus and tart apple, a hint of clove, and a mild funkiness in the background. Body is sharp and effervescent. Flavour is complex - notes of citrus, Brett, lemongrass, clove, white pepper, Belgian yeast, a hint of oak, and more - but it’s so well-intergrated and refreshing that it’s paradoxically simple as well. Just a beautiful beer all around, and one that I hope stays available in Ontario for a long time.
Cloudy yellow, thin white head. Nose is Belgian yeast, wheat, light malt. Sweet. Middle is creamy, orange, and spice. Finish is slightly dry and very refreshing.
November 2012. Bottle. 2012 version. Pale yellow color with a white head. Aromas of grass, hay, citrus, yeast and malt. Bready flavors mixed with banana and citrus. Extremely well made saison.
Pours golden haze, two finger head, scent of sour citrus, earthy citrusy taste, very light on the palate, very refreshing.

Poured at Republic at Seven Corners in a tulip-like glass. Refreshing top notch take on a Belgian saison. Beautiful golden color with little to no head. Hits you with understated hops and an effervescent finish. One of the best around leaving you longing for a trip to Chi-town and Lou Malnatti’s.

7.99! for a bomber of this at my local podunk market. How can anyone pass this shit up?  A solid Belgian mellow farmhouse ale with just the right amount of zing to keep me intrigued.   yeah yeah...so what that ABIBev owns them.....at least its still a high quality product you downtrodden negative fixated momo’s!  I’m pissed at myself for not buying two....I mean how many times a year do I actually go to the grocery store by myself and have Carte Blanche to buy whatever...... I could have easily finished two bombers and had a nice nap.

straight from the bottle like a man as always...bit sour like I am told a farmhouse saison should be. 
carby, mellow hops, tangy lemon, vanilla slight, citrus rind. Creamy on the tongue at first and goes mild acid quickly after. Carbs and burps follow that are not immediately perceptable (carbonation is a bit high)
creamy if you let it linger in the mouth at first but gets much more sour if you hold it
creamy orange and lemon rinds...top end beer but there are others at the price
nothing wrong with this one but I am searching for a different  taste..85%

Pours a cloudy golden colour, looks very similar to a standard wheat beer. Aroma notes include ripe fruits such as apple, pear, with some yeasty funk thrown in the mix. The tasting notes include sour apple, pear, and even a hint grapes (perhaps from the win barrels). Spices, and slight bitterness round out this spectacular beer. Saison’s are one of my favorite styles, nothing like a good saison on a patio soaking up some sun!

765mL bottle from LCBO.  Pours cloudy and yellow.  Funky yeast aroma with sour apple.  Taste is spicy and herbal, yeasty, and not as bitter as I would’ve expected.  Lemon, apple, and cloves are present.

Pours a subtly faint yellow from the bottle while forming a decent head on top that will linger for a bit.  The nose provides hints of lemony citrus and some sourness to it.  Very sparkling and complex, great for those that like Belgium style ales and saisons.  Not bad, just not my thing

Pours golden yellow with three fingers of foam that lingers. Smell is classic Belgian yeast smell with sour notes. Mild chill haze. Taste is refreshing and quite complex. Can taste the Brett, grass, orange peal, and mild cotton candy. Thin consistency with mild sour aftertaste. Very good beer

Pours clear straw little bit of head and little lacing. Nose is apple tart and yeast. Notes of tart apples, yeast, lemon and a slightly spicy finish. Light body with a nice dry finish. Lovely.

Bottle thanks to my brother for my birthday! Pours a hazy golden yellow from the bottle with nice lady white head that sticks decently. Aroma of citrus, lemon and orange, the funky yeast and a almost witbier spice. Taste follows, a very nice saison. Good stuff.
Poured from a room temperature bottle into a glass, nice Yellow color with a decent head, sweet aroma with a hint of spices and fruit, light mango taste compliments the ale.
Pours a hazy straw. Aroma is is lemon, straw, orange, yeast. Medium bodied, quite effervescent. Flavour has ripe summer fruits, some spice, lemon, and a tart, funky finish. Nice.

Bottle at club w. smells floral. Didn't know it was aged it oak barrels. Light floral , citrus taste. It's aight.

bottle into glass... Cloudy bright yellow pour..white head.. Powerful  aroma ofa spice and alc. Taste is very carbonated taste... Bitter finish...  good

750ml bottle;  pours a pale straw clouded ale in the glass with frothy 2 finger white cap – excellent lacing. Tart/sour notes, some light malt sweetness, great funky earthy tones like a wild inoculated ale. Bright sharp peppery-tart-dry character. Light body. Flavour has pleasant souring in front later some spice and fruity notes (like a pear cider) arrive, hop balance is there but not needed with the tartness – fast dry peppery finish with a hint of sweetness at the finish. Refreshing, light dry, yet satisfying.

Pours a somewhat hazy golden with no head. Aroma is really rustic with a grainy and barnyard-y nose. Some citrus too. Taste is quite dry with an undercover bitterness. It isn’t unbalanced though, don’t you worry. Flavors again are really what I think an "old time" saison would be: citrusy and spicy. Body is medium and carbonation lively, ultra drinkable. Quite a masterpiece!

Bottle to goblet
Aroma of fruit, horse blanket, lemon, pepper, and sulfur. Colour is cloudy, yellow with a thin white head. Taste is yeasty, sour, and a nice light bitterness.
Bottle. Poured an unfiltered golden yellow color with a white top. Taste of lemon zest, spice, orange peel, dry finish. High fizzy carbonation, low-medium body.
Always nice when someone pops a bottle of this.  Nice and sweet up front, grassy and oaky with grape tannins hidden throughout.  Have never aged one, but I’m sure it’d be nice...

Had two bottles of this from the LCBO. I am rating based on the first bottle but I am drinking the second bottle (different day) and all I can taste is chardonnay! Is it a result of the beer needing to develop a bit more, or is it a matter of "light pollution"? In other words, do I put the overly funky aroma and lack of beer taste to the brewer, or the LCBO? Anyway, the first bottle I had was wonderful. Unlike this second bottle, everything the first time around was so well mixed: the sweet apple undertones, the funky chardonnay flavours, and some of the herbal, refreshing notes one might expect from a saison. It was my first Goose Island beer and I was impressed! I’m assuming that this second bottle is a bit of a one off--as one might expect to happen, and it’s far from undrinkable.
Draft. Pours hazy yellow gold. Tastes like citrus, herbs, wheat. Smells like lemon and cardamom. Medium body and low carbonation. Very good.

A very effervescent saison with some interesting chardonnay flavors and some apple-like esters. Effervescent. Mild funk to it. Very approachable. Like a milder Unibroue Éphémère. Fantastic on a hot afternoon.
Bottle from Canals. Nice blend of sour and citrus fruits. Nice notes of bread, pepper, and spice. Good company, good brew.
Pours hazy peach color. Spicy straw and cat urine aroma. Flavor is a nice sour yeasty flavor with a slight funk. A papery bitter with a slight white wine sweetness. Finishes dry and delicious.

Head doesn’t last long. Smell is light sweetness,fruit,grass. Taste is bitterness,grass,grapefruit,yeasty,bready. Golden color. Medium-heavy bodie. Little bit of a burn from 6.5% Pair’s well with some Mild Holland Guda cheese and some blue cheese I am eating with it! Cheer’s!!!!

On tap at Blue monk. Yellow pour with a nice substantial white head. Aroma is some yeast with some floral notes and orange rind. Not a strong scent. Taste is smooth and mild sweet with a relatively long finish. Yeast and orange blossom.

765 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a cloudy, straw yellow with lasting white head.  Aroma is funky yeast with zesty citrus, bread and spice.  Flavour is quite fruity with pear, white grape, tropical fruit and orange peel, underlying funk and some gentle spiciness.  Lively carbonation.  Very nice.

Pours a hazy pale straw colour with foamy white head. Aromas of sour lacto, farmy yeast and a bit woody. Really taste the lacto balanced by sweetness. Nice fruit and slight oak. Champagne mouth feel. Good beer!
This beer had a slight sweetness with a spicy dry finish.  Nice and crisp with a mellow hop character
Smells winey and citrusy, maybe a hint of oak/wood.  Taste is very dry, tart and spicy.  Citrusy flavors as well.  Very tasty

750 mL bottle.  Pours a hazy straw color with a foamy white head.  Aromas of  curacao, bell pepper, biscuit and tropical fruit.  A touch of sweetness backed by lacto sourness, vegetal hop and a lightly oaky finish. High carbonation with a champagne like mouth feel.  Delightfully refreshing and pleasantly complex.

Draught at Flo & Santos. Poured clear yellow with creamy white head. Sweet fruity aromas. Tangy tingly wheat flavor. Very enjoyable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Right one the bottle is opened, tons of brett aroma coming through on the nose. On closer inspection, get some mild malt sweetness, the orange peel and spice. Appearance is quite interesting, looks quite unique -- almost like carbonated pineapple juice. Head is very thin and frothy. Taste is delicious, quite sour upfront, spice in the middle and a clean finish with a hint of Belgian yeast. Don’t get much of the advertised oak barrel, but maybe I’m just comparing this to the Dulcis Succubus. Medium bodied, highly carbonated and highly refreshing.

Big bottle, 2013 edition.  Aroma is a musty fruitiness. The appearance is a hazy yellow.  The taste starts off tart and turns and turns to a mellow almost lemon, almost pear flavor. Palate is nice. Overall, a very refreshing, nice beer. Hope ab inbev doesn't ruin it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

765ml bottle. Hazy yellow pour, big rocky white head. Tart, lightly funky aroma. Some grass, wet hay, and straw mixed with yeast and citrus. Lively mouthfeel and carb. Finish is peppery, and tart with a medium bitterness. Crisp finish and quite refreshing. Very impressive.

Pours a hazy golden/yellow with a decent amount of head and a lot of lacing. I got a lot of year floating around in my pour, which made me giddy. Aroma is very sweet and yeasty. Apple, grapefruit, pear and lemon. Delicious on the nose. Mouth is also yeasty and sweet. Very breadlike with apple, pear and grapefruit.

Pours yellowish straw with a white enduring head. The aroma is a typical Belgian citrusy sweetness. Flavor follows the aroma. Hints of banana and pineapple. Light spice.
Medium body. Light carbonation.
Not bad. Nothing to write home about, but mejor que nada. Actually, a nice brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
cloudy straw, rocky white head. bubblegum, citrus, cereal, earthy. lightly sour, light sweetness, lightly bitter. medium body, slick feel, average carbonation. boring, honestly.

12 oz bottle. Bottled 10/22/12. Pours a hazy golden color with a white foamy head. Aroma of sweet fruits, wine, and citrus.  Taste has a nice spicy tingle, with vanilla, citrus, floral, and fresh fruits.  Love this! Refreshing, crisp and spicy.  Great carbonation. A bit of a dry wine finish.  I could drink this all day.

Bomber into Trappist glass.  Hazy golden yellow color, very carbonated, with white head.  Aroma of fruity Belgian yeast (citrus/tropical fruits), spices (mainly clove), some floral notes and sweet malt.  Taste is notes of bread, pear, white grapes, champagne, lemon, grapefruit, some pepper and somewhat herbal.  Light body, heavy carbonation, foamy mouth-feel, effervescent, crisp, dry finish that’s a little tart.  Very tasty stuff, this beer makes the spritzy mouth-feel work for me.

This beer is a little bit on the sweet side, but it is still very nice. Would be excellent drink for a summer day. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazy off colored light yellow with a small head, with some sparkling carbonation. Nose is fruity and yeasty.Taste is lemony and ’ yeasty ’, tastes more like a sparkling wine / champagne. Finish is dry, spicy. Was pleasantly surprised by the taste and how drinkable Sofie was. Quaff Score 8 / 10

Pours a cloudy yellow with a white head and aroma of yeast and fruits. Taste is of Belgain yeast, tart fruits, lemon, and spices with a dry, spicy and some bitterness in the  finish. Different for a saison, interesting brew
Light yellow, cloudy, very carbonated.  Aroma of belgian yeast, wheat and funk.  Taste followed though from the aroma.  Finished nice and dry.  Very refreshing and tasty.
bright light gold with pure white topper, busy carbonation, fruity and dry, decent hop btiterness.  really refreshing

Bottle - pours cloudy golden with light frothy head.  Nose of cloves, grass, and  tropical fruit.  Smooth mouthfeel.  Taste of cloves and citrus.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From bottle. 2012 vintage. Cloudy yellow color. Crisp citrus aroma. Sparkly effervescence with flavors or orange, pear, apple and a little spice. Finishes with a sweet bubbliness.

Hmm, I was expecting a little more. Pretty much your typical saison to a tee w/ possibly a little more flavor. Nice flavor upfront but finishes too clean & watery.  Pleasant aroma & overall a decent brew.

12 Fl. Oz. Poured cloudy bright yellow, nice white head, bubbly and with lots of lacing. Aroma of citrus fruits and some yeast. Taste if fruity, citrusy, a bit tart but very nice. Quite drinkable, crisp and refreshing.
Lots of floaties. Full flavor, with lightish body. Citrus and coriander flavors. Delicious.
Pours champagne color, good carbonation.  Earthy aroma, spicy nose.  Lemon, citrus taste.  A littl3e bitter for the class.

Une autre dégustation offerte par Ben.  Ça commence à être gênant…  Vintage 2012.  Embouteillée le 11/13/12.  Numéro de la bouteille : 1545.  Un liquide jaune paille traversée par un million de fins sédiments.  Une tête discrète et blanche.  Un nez très invitant avec ses notes sauvages.  Des raisins blancs qui piquent les narines.  Des fleurs printanières et des notes citronnées.  Des parfums de blé et des épices : du poivre et de la coriandre?  Des saveurs de campagne.  Des malts pâles et du blé tendre.  Des bretts qui se développent.  Une touche d’agrumes complimentée par un raisin blanc acidulé.  Un effet épicé qui revient sans cesse.  Une bouche délicate.  Un corps sculpté par des bulles vivantes et fait sur mesure pour mon palais.  Une finale sèche et astringente avec ses notes de blé, sa levure et ses notes efficaces de fruits enfûtés.  Trop facile à boire.  Une véritable délectation.

It pours translucent (slightly cloudy) champagne coloured, with a slight greenish tint; the head is white and mousse-like (very thick). A special note about the appearance is that the carbonation only arises from the middle of the glass in a thin spiral column. The aroma has notes of: orange peel, white-grape, barnyard funk, and sweet malts. The taste is medium spicy, that finishes with a light sourness; there are notes of: orange peel, grass, coriander, and lemon juice. The palate is medium bodied, has a big foamy mouth-feel, medium carbonation, and a long bitter finish. Overall, a visually stunning beer with plenty of aroma and taste to boot.

Le liquide est doré et parsemé de flocons de levures.Sans col avec un anneau de mousse blanche.Au nez,les bretts sont présents,la chaire de raisins blanc,la poussière des chemins de campagne.Au goût,une douceur,suivi d’une touche de vinaigre de vin blanc,d’un pétillement des bulles dans les joues et le palais,sans oublier les bretts.Toute une amalgame de saveurs plus plaisante les unes que les autres.Une bière des plus savoureuse et distinguée.

Pours havy yellow with big lasting bubbly head. The aroma on this is a little estery with a bit of barnyard. Floral and vibrant, and not too heavy on the yeast. Starts rather sweet and fruitier than I would expect. Lots of lemon and citrus flavors to start. Has a nice lively carbonation in the middle, before a little tart astringency comes through later on. Nice tartness and a nice change up. 

-Fish!

Pours hazy, straw yellow with plenty of effervescence.  Head was pure white and fell off to some pleasant lacing.  Nose is big with lemon, grass and funk.  It offers up a little spice, a little sour and some florals. As it warms it gives some cracker, some medicinal alcohol and clove. Grainy with a touch of sweetness.  Taste follows the nose all the way and pucker up because its tart. Flavors all come  together, lemony citrus, bread, yeast,a little pepper.  Taste doesn’t quite live up to the nose but it’s close. Sharp on the tongue at first but you get used to it .  Sweet, tangy, finishes earthy, crisp and slightly bitter. This was tremendously flavorfull and off dry.  Very well done.
Not very "saison"-like to me but very good. Poured an innocent yellow with fluffy head. Very soft around the palate.
Tasted in 2010 (backlog). Hazy pale yellow apearance with a large white head. Aroma is of yeast and citrus. Taste is the same.

On tap at the Knick. Herbal, peppery, citrus rind, sweet with honey and orange blossom. Oak and chardonnay. Tart fruity character. Golden clear with light, light haze and very thin white head. Medium body with medium-high carbonation. Starts medium sweet with grapefruit, coriander, light chardonnay, and herbal notes. A bit of yeasty funky note but not outrageous. Nice tart finish with fruity chardonnay after; mild chalky bitterness component.
This beer pours a golden color. The nose is mainly floral notes. The pallet is floral coriander, pink pepper, orange and yeast. I really enjoyed this beer.

A floral pour for sure. Pours a somewhat cloudy straw yellow. Aroma is strongly floral with notes of yeast and spice. Taste is of yeast and floral notes and a faint bit of funk. Finishes relatively dry with slight tartness.
Golden with a nice lacing head. Aroma of funk, citrus, spice, and grass. Taste is funky with some fruit and spice. Medium bodied; smooth. Nice.

Appealing aroma of barnyard funkiness combined with touches of spice and citrus. Pours a light yellow with a white head which quickly dies and leaves no lacing. The taste is a bit of bubble gum, orange citrus, peppery spice with grainy finish. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel. Overall, a very tasty and enjoyable Saison. Would drink again.
Awesome saison drank in Chicago with friends, full body, light citrus taste, overall good.

Clear gold with a fluffy white head. Really nice lacing. Aroma has some barnyard, dust, lemon, and grass. Taste has lemon, pepper, a bit of funk, and a nice tartness to it. Dry finish. Very soft on the palate. Really nice saison.

Poured a hazy straw yellow with two fingers of white bubbly head that leaves behind good lacing.  Aroma is subtle but complex with some lemon, cracker malt, light fruit sweetness and a bit of barnyard.  Taste has the same subtle complexities.  Lemon, orange and light fruit flavors with the cracker malt followed by white pepper and an earthiness or leathery component.  Just a hint of tartness and funk in the finish.   Flavors are all wonderfully light and balanced, with nothing overpowering.  Starts off with some sweetness but ends up being fairly dry with a medium mouthfeel.   Very nice and drinkable cross between a Belgian pale and a saison.  Really enjoyed. 

---Jeremy H

Bottle from Village Wine and Spirits in Athens. Yeast, esters, apples, and light sugary nose. Very pale straw, thin fine white head. Light tangy fruit initial, with apples and pears / settles into an even lighter fruit mid, with a little bitternes / finish is mild, with some lingering fruit and a sense of balance. Thin-medium body.  Pleasant. Nothing really special here. Kind of a Belgian lite.
On tap.  comes a clear bright gold with a small white head.  Aroma of citrus, yeast, and spice.  Taste is lemons, oranges, yeast, spices, malt, and vanilla.  Nice stuff.

Bomber->SA.  Pours clear straw with small effervescent white head.  Aroma is a blend of yeast, citrus and herbs.  Flavor is sour funky yeast with citrus and herbs.  Lively carbonation.  Light and refreshing.  Very good.

Appearance was cloudy pale gold with diminishing tiny rocky off white head, no lacing. Aromas are sweet biscuity malts, floral, grass, pine, barnyard funky yeasts. Taste are citrus fruits of orange, lemon, pine with a smash of Sour Bretts yeasts, no alcohol present. Palate was soft smooth CO2 with light-meduim body, then lasting barnyard funky citrusy finish. A wonderful Saison.
Bright yellow color with big, soapy, white head. Aroma of Belgian yeast, spicy pepper, and sweet pear juice. Yeast flavor is strong. Really solid!
This is a hazy yellow beer with a lot of banana and gum. Reminds me of a hefe plus a little spritzy bite. The aroma is earthy.

Aroma of ginger and orange. See through golden color with a small foam. Very sweet flavors of orange, mango, lemon and some yeast. Overall, very full flavor  with a nice alcohol burn on the finish. I’d give this an A rating.

Vintage 2012, bottled on 11/06/12.  Bright yellow pour, white foam.  Aroma of worn, ladies undies.  Tastes like a sweet teens vagina.  Technically, I suppose it has flavors of creamy vanilla, hints of tangerine, essence of vinted fruit.  Very fruity, nice malt.  Awesome!  (3621)

Hazy yellow color with a thin highly carbonated head. Crisp citrusy taste with Belgian yeast in the aroma and palate. The orange/coriander is evident and gives the beer a nice character. Solid refreshing beer overall. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled on 07/09/12.
Pours a cloudy yellow-orange, white, soapy head.
Aroma - Really fresh melon, citrus, orange wallop. Really nice perfume. Belgian yeast, spices.
Taste - Pineapple, big juicy citrus and melons. Good interplay of sweet and sour citrus with tart white cranberry. Sour, caramel apple too.
Palate - Not an overly drying saison, which is not necessarily a bad thing. Crisp.
Very, very nice.

bottle. light golden with small head. one of the first saisons i ever had, and i’d have to say, i still think it’s one of the best. light, but very flavorful. tart amd fruity and spicey. i can’t imagine who wouldn’t like this one -- even folks who don’t like beer.

Draft at Farmers Cabinet. Tulip glass. Slightly cloudy gold pour. Minimal aroma behind the thick frothy white head. Wheat/Blonde heightend by some nice vinous barrel flavors. UPDATE: Have had a few times since and my opinion has improved.

Pours a golden color with a large white head.  I’m surprised to see this listed expressly as a Saison because it had more typical "Belgian Ale"-type characteristics.  It wasn’t quite as dry as I would expect a saison to be.  Solid, but really just serviceable.
Solid Belgian Pale Saison with a spicy and yeasty character that is upfront on top of a sweet pale malt base and oranges. Like the wine character which reminds me a bit of zinfandel.

12oz bottle from Rustica, Kalamazoo, MI.  

Aroma:  sour berries, spicy nose with some complex spices, perhaps clove, pepper and some lemon

Appearance: cloudy, highly carbonated pale straw yellow pour with half inch of white head and no shortage of rolling bubbles

Taste: tingly, medium high carbonation with very light mouth feel.  Sour tart fruit taste with some sour malt.  hearty flavor but still light and uplifting.  

Finish: dry crisp feeling, sour malt flavor, a little tingly again

Pours a cloudy yellow color with aroma of lemon peels.  Taste is tart, dry, with an easy drinkability.  A slight vanilla tinge to the beer with a light finish.  Overall a good saison that was surprisingly tasty.
Pours straw with a white head. Quite distinct sour fruity nose. Very tart, hints of grapefruit, esters. Tastes like a mild lambic. Very good, indeed!

12oz Bottle A - Pours hazy straw with a small white head. Ok lacing. S - Citrus peel, tart/sour. Like the nose of a good Sau. Blanc. T - Bright citrus, in particular lemon. M - Light/medium bodied. Tingling carbonation. Dry finish. O - Great nose, solid Saison.
Very pale hazy yellow with a pale head. Aroma is lemon zest, fresh grapefruit juice. Light and fruity on the palate with a citrusy finish. Taste is dry white wine, lemon grass. Refreshing!

It pours a light hazy golden leaving a large one inch foamy and bubbly white head in my pint glass. Though pretty hazy, carbonation is still seen rising. Foamy lacing is left. The smell has the orange, lemon and Belgian yeast up front, but combined nicely. The taste is sharp around the citrus yet some distinct refreshing sweet qualities from some light malts make a slight presence. Lemon comes in really strong close to the end of the pint glass. The palate is light to medium with adequate sharpness on the tongue. I’d say this is pretty drinkable. It leaves a sticky aftertaste and finish. Overall, this is good for its style and good for me.
The best part of this beer was the citrusy grapefruit flavor. There were subtle notes of vanilla that snuck in. Really good, light and refreshing.
Bottle in NYC sept 2012. Hazy yellow beer with a big offwhite head, not lasting. Grapefruit, citrus and a bit rubber aroma. Sourish and sweet, citrus and spicy flavour. Nice beer :-)

Tap: hazy pale yellow pour with a medium-sized white head. Nose is yeasty with citrus and some dusty grains. Flavor is malty thick with some honey sweetness and light orange. Nice flavor but lacking in spice and yeasty funk I was looking for.

Drank out of 12 oz bottle poured into glass. Aroma- smells like flowers and lemon squeezed into a glass. Appearance- very mild yellow. Almost like pilsner. Taste- mmmm. Smooth and lemony with a hint of sour. I love it. Palate- whoa. The lemon and zest pop here. Overall- my favorite saison i have had. So smooth and refrshing. Would be great on summer day.

2012 on tap. Slightly sweet, Fuji apples, brightly effervescent, saison-y for a moment until the Belgian Pale Ale side kicks in. Imminently sessionable, and turns beautifully sour with a few years of age. Love this beer.

Pours golden, slightly cloudy with a medium head. Hints of bread and citrus on the nose;  its a bit doughy almost. Light sour and sweet tones and very tasty. Light body with fizzy carbonation and a dry slightly bitter finish
